Ritah is married with three children aged 8 to 2 years and she also takes care of her parents. She would like to build a residential house for her children so that they can enjoy more comfort.

Ritah needs a loan to help buy more baking flour, sugar, yeast, and other items for her business. In future, she would also like to have a boutique which will bring in more income.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, sugar, yeast and other items for her business

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es: La Srta.valeria se dedica a la produccion de mantas para cholitas (mujer del pueblo)en su domicilio, las mantas las confecciona de tela de seda, a eso le pone las flecaduras; sus ventas son al credito que generalmente deja a las  vendedoras de los mercados de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz. Con esa actividad  ayuda a sus padres a mantener su  hogar y a los estudios de sus hermanos, tambien cubren sus estudios de la universidad ya que le falta solo un año para poder egresar, podemos indicar tambien que la cliente es muy trabajadora y responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Valeria produces shawls for “cholitas” (village women). She works at home, making the shawls from silk and adding a frill. She sells on credit, generally to the stallholders in the markets in the south of La Paz city. This provides income to help her parents maintain the household and enable her siblings to study; she also helps pay for her own university studies; she has just a year left before she graduates. Valeria is very hard-working and fulfils her obligations responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials (cloth)

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
K. Annet is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is 35 years old and married with five children aged 18 to 2 years. She also takes care of other orphans.

Annet has a retail shop in Kaazi trading centre and she is able to make 200,000/= as profits a week and this helps her take care of her family plus her children.

Before the retail shop, Annet was a farmer and she is grateful for her loans in addition to her good customer care skills. In future, Annet would like to be a wholesaler, supplying to other shop owners as well as educating her children to the highest levels.

Annet needs a new loan to help restock her retail shop with more goods. She is really a determined and hardworking lady.

loans.use: To restock her retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Kwame Mkurumah Group

texts.en:
Rehema P., age 37, is married and has three children, ages 13, 11 and 6 years.  She has a business selling vegetables, such as beans, potatoes and corn, which she imports from the north of Tanzania. Additionally, Rehema has a chicken farm with approximately 500 chicks. She has run the business successfully for the past four years and works daily from 5:30 am until 6 pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $1800.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her stock of vegetables, and has paid back the loan successfully. Rehama now hopes for a loan to add an additional 200 birds to her chicken farm to increase her business.  
	
Rehama will share this loan with her loan group, Kwame Mkurumah, which totals fourteen members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.  In the picture, Rehama is seated in the light pink dress in the center front.

loans.use: To buy 200 chicks

loans.name: Leovina Encarnacion

texts.es: La Sra. Leovina, trabaja con Emprender desde el año 2001, con credito individual, ella tiene una tienda tipo almacen, ya que tiene muchos productos a la venta, este negocio esta ubicado en la zona de Obrajes, su esposo es transportista de microbus, tienen dos hijos jóvenes,la mayor ya tiene una vida independiente, el otro hijo esta postulando para seguir estudios superiores, es una familia muy unida y trabajadora, ya que con su negocio y el del esposo adquirieron bienes para el hogar, asi como un nuevo transporte que trabaja como radiotaxi.La señora Leovina siempre demostro puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Leovina has been regular borrower from Emprender since 2001. She has a general store where she sells a very broad range of merchandise. Her business is located in the Obrajes neighborhood. Her husband is a microbus driver. They have two childen; the elder has left home, and the younger is preparing for university. They are a close-knit, hard-working family. Their two businesses have enabled them to furnish their home and also enabled her husband to become a taxi-driver. Leovina has track-record of punctual repayments.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cakes and beverages for the year-end festivities

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha K. is 33 years old and married with two children aged 17 and 14 years, plus she takes care of her siblings.

Martha has a restaurant in Gayaza that has been operating for eight years because of the good service and meals that she offers. She is able to make $27 in profit a week, and this helps her in running her home, restocking her business with more food, buying needed utensils and paying her rent.

Martha wants to educate her children through the University, which she has been working toward ever since her children were young.

At this time, Martha needs a loan to help increase her stock of rice, maize flour, beans and so on for expanding her business operation.

loans.use: To buy a stock of rice, maize flour, beans and so on for expanding her operation.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 53 years old and is married with three children and one dependent.  Their children and dependent are between 4 and 21 years old.  Priscilla has been a proven entrepreneur for seven successful years in the highly competitive restaurant business. She employs five people from her community in her restaurant and the hours of her business require that they work from early in the morning until late in the night, often until the last customer leaves.

Priscilla is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a refrigerator for juice and soda which she also plans to sell. With this refrigerator, Priscilla hopes to attract more customers to her restaurant and hopefully earn more profit in the process.  Priscilla will save a portion of any profits earned, as a major goal for her is to build a secure future financial stability for her business as well as her children.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator for beverages

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
This is Abibatu C.. She is 31 years old, married, and is from Tombo in Waterloo. She has four children: one boy and three girls, one in secondary school, two in primary school and the last in nursery school.

Abibatu has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken three previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Abibatu has a shop where she sells rice by the bag in Tombo town. With her previous loans she expanded her business by purchasing additional inventories of rice; with her new loan she hopes to add more goods to her business like groundnut (peanut) oil, rubber and sugar by bag. With these new goods, Abibatu hopes her profits will grow even more.

loans.use: To buy new goods for sale, such as groundnut oil, bagged sugar, and rubber

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is Marie P.. She is 29 years old, married, and is from Tombo in Waterloo. Marie has two children: one boy and one girl - one in primary school and one in nursery school.

Marie has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Marie sells palm oil and garri (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) at Wharf in Tombo town. With her previous loans she expanded her business by increasing her inventory of the goods she already sells. With her new loan she hopes to increase her business again in the same way.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil and garri

loans.name: Rita Marcia

texts.es: Rita, tiene una pequeña pulpería, pequeña después de haber aquejado  una enfermedad por algunos meses, se separo de esposo tiene tres hijos los cuales están a su cuidado pero sin el descuido de su padre. También se dedica a la elaboración del Pan casero para la venta en su pulpería como para la distribución en varias ventas de su zona, teniendo otro ingreso por esta actividad diferente al de la pulpería. Vive en la casa de los tíos, siendo la única sobrina que los cuida, el trabajo que realiza es muy fuerte para una mujer sola pero la Sra. Rita a sobrellevado la situación perfectamente. El proyecto mas inmediato que tiene es el de vender almuerzo los fines de semana en la misma casa ya que la casa es bastante grande contando con un patio amplio y cómodo para dicho negocio. La señora emprendió este negocio hace dos años, actualmente la señora se encuentra trabajando para salir adelante y sacar profesionales a sus tres hijos que aun se encuentran en el colegio. Cliente nueva con crédito individual en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Rita has a small grocery store. After suffering an illness for several months, she separated from her husband. She has three children under her care, but she raises them without the support of their father. Rita also prepares homemade bread that she sells in her store and also distributes to other retailers in the area. This provides her with additional income above the revenues she generates from her store. She lives in the home of her aunt and uncle, since she is the only niece for whom they have cared.

Her latest project is selling lunches on the weekends from her house, since it is large enough and has an expanded patio to accommodate such a business. She has been engaged in this business for two years. Rita is currently working to get ahead and see that her children who are now in high school eventually become professionals. She is a new client who is receiving an individual loan from our Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide additional operating capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a fish seller. She sells ice fish to make a living in her community in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She is a focused, hard worker. She is very determined to lift her business and her family out of poverty. She is married with seven children and she is 56 years old. She has been in this business for a long time.

Mary hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more ice fish to sell. This is the high season for her business, and she hopes to make more profits for her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice fish to sell

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is Fatmata S.. She is 40 years old, married, and is from Tombo in Waterloo. She has three children: one boy and two girls - two in secondary school and one in primary school.

Fatmata has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Fatmata sells wrapping (a type of Sierra Leonean cloth) from her house in Tombo town. With her previous loans she expanded her business by increasing her inventory of cloth. With her new loan she hopes to increase her business again by buying more of the same goods.

loans.use: To buy more wrapping

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is Isatu M.. She is 54 years old, married, and is from Tombo in Waterloo. She has two children: one boy and one girl, both in secondary school.

Isatu has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Isatu sells Sierra Leonean staple goods such as rice, Maggi (a common spice) and hot pepper (used in almost all local cooking) at the Wharf in Tombo town. With her previous loans she expanded her business by purchasing additional inventories of these goods.

With her new loan Isatu hopes to increase her business in the same way and make a greater profit. She then intends to put some of this profit aside in a bank savings account.

loans.use: To buy rice, Maggi, and pepper

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is Mariatu K.. She is 27 years old, married, and is from So-so Town Lane in Waterloo. She has four children: one boy and three girls; three are in primary school and one is still a baby.

Mariatu has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken three previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Mariatu works from home selling such staple goods as rice, palm oil, vegetable oil and sugar. With her previous loans she expanded the inventory of her shop, keeping the same goods for sale. With her new loan she hopes to expand her business again in the same manner.

loans.use: To buy more rice, palm oil, vegetable oil, and sugar

loans.name: Ana Yenny

texts.es: Ana, comerciante, esta conviviendo con el señor Honoratito, tienen tres hijos pequeños, la señora Yenny anteriormente trabajaba en una casa como empleada domestica, es allí donde vio que la señora de la casa se dedicaba al negocio de traer ropa, sabanas, edredones y otros productos de la ciudad de Oruro, le nació la inquietud de entrar en el negocio donde recibió ayuda de la dueña de casa, llevándola a los viajes para traer los productos como la distribución en los mercados de la ciudad de Santa Cruz. Hace 3 años que se independizo y  trae todo lo anteriormente mencionado actualmente tiene su casa propia heredada tiene una pequeña construcción que lo levanto con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y el de su esposo. Hace 6 meses que nació la última de sus pequeñas, por lo que dejo de viajar y su capital fue acortándose. El crédito que saco en nuestra institución le será de muchísima ayuda para poder volver a viajar y crecer nuevamente en capital. Actualmente estaba comprando poca mercadería pero acá en Santa Cruz para distribuirlo de forma unitaria en las instituciones con  ganancias poco alentadoras. El sueño que tiene es el de poder traer mucha mercadería como lo hacia la dueña de casa y esta manera terminar la construcción de su casa como el de comprarse su propio vehículo.
texts.en:
Ana, a business woman, lives with Señor Honoratito and they have three small children. Mrs. Yenny used to work as a housekeeper and it was there that she first saw that the woman she worked for brought clothes, sheets, quilts and other products from Oruro as her business. This sparked her interest in the business and, with the help of her employer, she began to drive her on the trips to distribute the products in the markets in Santa Cruz. Three years ago she became independent and brings all the before-mentioned products to her home, which she inherited, where she has a small building she and her husband worked to put up. Six months ago her youngest child was born and, because of this, she stopped traveling and her resources have begun to decrease. The loan she would like to receive from this organization would be of much help to allow her to start traveling and begin to increase profits once again. Lately she is buying very little merchandise, but here in Santa Cruz she could distribute it all at once to the businesses with encouraging profits. Her dream is to be able to bring a lot of merchandise like her former employer did and, in this way, finish the construction of her home and buy her own vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel French, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increased Resources

loans.name: Yemi

texts.en:
Yemi is a fashion designer, and she makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers. She also sells tailoring materials. She has been in this business for a long time. She is happily married with one child. She is 30 years old.

She is a LAPO client. The Kiva field partner, LAPO (Lift above poverty organization), is committed to improving lives in Nigeria. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. Yemi is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring materials. Yemi says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is Aminata S.. She is 54 years old and married. She comes from Tombo, an area within Waterloo. She has four children: two boys and two girls. One is in secondary school and the rest have grown up.

Aminata has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Aminata sells palm oil and bananas by walking in the street at Tombo town. With her previous loans she expanded her business by purchasing additional inventory. With her new loan she hopes to increase her business again in the same way.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil and bananas

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel M. M. tiene 22 años de edad. 
Vive en casa de sus padres quienes le han brindado un espacio para que habite junto a su esposa e  hija de 1 año de edad.
Trabaja todos los días recorriendo los 3 mercados de Ica ( Toledo, Huancavelica, Sto. domingo). Se dedica a la venta de verduras y tuberculos desde las 5:30 am hasta las 2:30 pm esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años en forma continua.
Los señores gozan de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos. Son una pareja joven que tienen el deseo de superarse poco a poco para comprar sus bienes y mas adelante poder tener el apoyo para construir al menos un ambiente propio que permita desarrollarse mejor.
Ellos desean el financiamiento para poder invertir un poco mas en su negocio ya que cuando traen la mercadería de Lima obtiene una mejor ganancia que les permite cubrir mejor sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel M. M. is a 22-year old man who lives with his wife and 1-year-old child in his parents' house. He sells root vegetables and greens in all three of Ica's markets (Toledo, Huancavelica, and Santo Domingo). He travels from one market to another from 5:30am to 2:30pm everyday.Miguel Angel has been doing this work for 3 years. He and his wife enjoy a good reputation with their neighbors. They are a young couple who want to improve their situation little by little, to buy a piece of land, and eventually to build a place to better develop their buisiness.They have requested this loan to enable them to purchase more in Lima, to increase their income and help them cover their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve his business

loans.name: Moromoke

texts.en:
Moromoke is happily married with two children. She is 30 years old and lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client. The Kiva field partner, LAPO (Lift above poverty organization), is committed to improving lives in Nigeria.

Moromoke sells children's clothing and shoes at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to own a boutique for children in the future.

Moromoke is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more children's clothing to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Isatu Adakalie

texts.en:
This is Isatu Adakalie K.. She is 45 years old, married, and is from Tombo in Waterloo. She has four children: three boys and one girl. One child is in secondary school and the rest have grown up.

Isatu has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Isatu sells cigarettes, soap and toothpaste from her house. With her previous loans she expanded her business by purchasing additional stores of the same goods. With her new loan she hopes to add more diverse goods to her business.

loans.use: To add more diverse goods to her business

loans.name: Saffie

texts.en:
This is Saffie M.. She is 50 years old, married, and is from So-so Town Lane in Waterloo. She has five children: two boys and three girls, one in secondary school and four in primary school.

Saffie has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken three previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Saffie sells her inventory of rice, palm oil, and coal from her house. With her previous loans she expanded the inventory of her shop. With her new loan she hopes to expand her business and put some of her profit in the bank as savings.

loans.use: To buy inventory like rice, palm oil and coal

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is Marie K.. She is 45 years old, married, and is from Tombo in Waterloo. She has four children: one boy and three girls, one in secondary school and three in primary school.

Marie has been a LAPOSL client for some time now, and has taken two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Marie sells bagged rice at the Wharf in Tombo. With her previous loans she expanded her business by purchasing extra inventory. With her new loan she hopes to add more stock to her business.

With the increase in profit, Marie plans to feed her children and repay her loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento Corazòn D. Jesùs  es grupo antiguo que se encuentra en su 8º ciclo es  un grupo muy responsable en sus pago y que no entraron en Mora ya que son socias comprometidas con nuestra Institucion. Este Banco esta dirigido por la Sra. Nancy como presidenta,  quien es la lider, responsable en sus pagos ella  tiene 1 hijo y tiene su negocio D. venta D. ropa para damas  en el mercadoD. la calle Tarara ( La Cancha), como Tesorera se encuentra la Sra. Fermina  quien es una persona activa  es casada tiene 2 hijas y tiene el negocio D. venta D. ropa para niños en el mismo mercado que el D. la presidenta   y como Secretaria se encuentra la socia Jenny, es divorsiada y  tiene 4 hijos tiene su negocio D. venta D. ropa en la ex estacion . El crèdito es para aumentar el Capital D. sus negocios.
En la fotografia el Sr.Jorge Ademir posa con su esposa.
texts.en:
The “Heart of Jesus Enterprise Bank” is a long-standing group of entrepreneurs in its 8th loan cycle. They are very committed members who have no defaults with our institution. The group’s leader is Señora Nancy, mother of one child, whose clothing sales business is located in the La Cancha market. The treasurer is Señora Fermina, an active married mother of 2 daughters. She sells children’s’ clothing in the same market. The secretary is Jenny, a divorced mother of 4, also a clothing vender. The loans they request are to increase their working capital. Señor Jorge is seen in the photograph with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Juan Xxi Group

texts.es:
Después de haberse capacitado 3 días  en los servicios que Pro Mujer ofrece, las 13 integrantes del grupo Juan XXI, decidieron solicitar el préstamo ya que todas tienen diversos negocios  como la venta de comida, tejido de mantas, bordados en falda, atención de tienda de barrio, venta de menudencias de carne, venta de carteras, venta de queso, confección de colchas y venta de papas. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería o materia prima.

Liderizadas por su mesa directiva elaboran su reglamento interno, con el cual trabajaran durante este ciclo, ellas  se reúnen en el Centro Focal Los Andes.
texts.en:
After having trained for three days in the services that Pro Mujer offers, the 13 members of the Juan XXI group decided to apply for a loan. They all have diverse businesses such as selling food, blanket weaving, skirt embroidery, neighborhood store services, selling organ meats, selling purses, selling cheese, making bedspreads and selling potatoes. They all need the loan to purchase merchandise or raw materials.

Led by their board of directors, they are creating their internal regulation with which they will work this cycle. They meet at the Los Andes regional office.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF MERCHANDISE AND RAW MATERIALS

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 40 years old and married with three children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Esther sells cooking oil and soup spices at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for a long time. She is a hardworking woman. She sells for long hours to enable her to meet the basic needs and necessities of her family members.

Esther is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. Esther is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more cooking oil and soup spices to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil and soup spices to sell

loans.name: Adejuju

texts.en:
O. sells medicines and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a maternity home in future. She is 31 years old and married with two children. They live in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is a focused hard worker. She has been in her business for seven years. O. is requesting a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more medicines and groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

O. is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and groceries to sell

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 44 años de edad, está separado y tiene un hijo de dos años de edad a su cargo. Vive junto a su padre en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de veinte años brinda servicios de reparación y mantenimiento de artefactos eléctricos. Aprendió el trabajo de forma empírica y poco a poco, gracias a sus ahorros, pudo adquirir un local cerca al mercado donde atiende a sus clientes. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con la que mantiene a su familia.

El nos cuenta que también compra artefactos de uso doméstico ya usados, a los que brinda mantenimiento y reparación para luego volver a venderlos a las personas que no cuentan con recursos suficientes para comprarse un artefacto nuevo. 

El poco capital con el que cuenta para la compra de repuestos no es suficiente y tiene que viajar continuamente a la ciudad de Chiclayo para adquirirlos, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es contruir su casa de material noble para así poder brindarle a sus familiares una mejor calidad de vida. El es una persona muy trabajadora y que gusta mucho del oficio que realiza.
texts.en:
Segundo is 44, separated, with one two-year old son that he cares for. He lives with his father in the Cayalti district, about one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For the last twenty years he has worked servicing and maintaining electrical products. He learned the trade through experience, and little by little, thanks to his savings, has been able to open up a business near the market and this is where he serves his customers. This business is the only income source for his family. He tells us that he also buys used household products, and repairs them so they can be resold to people who don’t have the money to purchase new ones. The little capital that he has to buy the replacement parts isn’t enough and he has to continually travel to Chiclayo to purchase them. That is why he is asking for a loan of 1000 new sols ($350.00) for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa. His greatest dream is to build a house out of good materials so that he can offer his family a better quality of life. He is very hard-working and is happy with his trade.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts to repair electrical products

loans.name: Rosa Luisa

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Luisa H. S. de 54 años de edad vive en Acomayo – Parcona – Ica junto con sus hijas y sus nietas en su casa propia.
Se dedica hace 30 años a la venta de verduras y otros tubérculos desde las 6:30 am hasta las 12:00 pm en el mercado de Huancavelica – Cercado de Ica. Gracias a su trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado que sus hijos sean profesionales actualmente y ella cuida a sus nietas en las tardes apoyando de esa manera a sus hijas.
También goza de buenas referencias de parte de los compañeros de trabajo y de sus vecinos.
Desea que la apoyemos para invertir mas en su negocio y asi poder comprar un nuevo toldo que le permita cubrirse un poco del sol ya que estamos en verano y su trabajo es en el día.
texts.en:
Rosa Luisa H. S., 54, lives in Acomayo, Parcona, Ica, with her daughters and granddaughters, in her own house. For 30 years she has sold vegetables and other tubers from 6:30am until 12pm in Huancavelica market, Cercado de Ica. Thanks to her work, effort and dedication she has seen her children become professionals and she still helps her daughters by babysitting her granddaughters in the afternoons. She also enjoys good references from her fellow workers and her neighbors. She wants our help to invest in her business by buying a new tarp cover that wil allow her to shelter from the sun since it is now Summer and she works during the daytime.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her vegetable sales.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu K.. She is 35 years old, married, and is from So-so Town Lane in Waterloo. She has five children: three boys and two girls, two in secondary school and three in primary school.

Kadiatu has been a LAPOSL client for some time now, and has taken three previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Kadiatu sells sandbags (often used to block the tide) and small boats at the Wharf. With her previous loans she expanded her business; with her new loan she hopes to add more boats and sandbags to her business.

loans.use: To purchase more boats and sandbags

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El señor David Gonzáles vive en casa en anticretico, en la zona  de las Lomas, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus tres hijos.
El señor David es empleado en la administración pública de esta ciudad y su esposa realiza transcripciones en una oficina particular, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de una computadora que le permita a su esposa trabajar en su domicilio para así poder cuidar a sus hijos y mantener sus ingresos familiares.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
David Gonzáles lives with his wife and three children in a house under the "anticrético" (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) modality in the Las Lomas area which is on the hillsides to the east of La Paz. David is a municipal employee and his wife does transcriptions in a private office. Their combined incomes are what supports the family. He is requesting financing to buy a computer so that his wife can work from home and therby be able to care for their children and still earn her income. This is their third loan request and the socioeconomic analysis done on them indicates that they qualify for and can manage this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer so that his wife can work doing transcriptions from home and care for her children at the same time.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 29 años de edad, se separó hace un año y tiene dos hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Es propietario de una mototaxi y brinda servicios de transporte de carga y pasajeros en Cayaltí y sus caseríos, siendo esta su única fuente de ingreso familiar. El nos cuenta que adquirió este vehículo hace dos años con los ahorros que obtuvo de su trabajo en una textilería de la ciudad de Lima.

El estado bastante accidentado de los caminos de la zona ha hecho que su unidad móvil empiece a sufrir fallas mecánicas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un joven bastante trabajador y muy entregado a su familia por lo que su más grande anhelo es brindarle una buena educación a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Luis is 29 years old; he has 2 children and has been separated from his wife for a year. He lives in his parents' house in Cayaltí district, located an hour from Chiclayo city. Luis owns a mototaxi and provides transport services for cargo and passengers in Cayaltí and the surrounding villages. This is his only source of income. He acquired the vehicle 2 years ago with money he saved from his work as a textile worker in the city of Lima. The rough condition of the roads in the area have caused mechanical damage to his vehicle, and he urgently needs to make repairs so that the vehicle can remain in good working condition. Thus, he finds it necessary to request his first loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Luis is a hardworking young man and very devoted to his family. His greatest wish is to provide his 2 children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mototaxi maintenance and repair costs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria G. vive en una casa en anticrítico en la zona de Vino Tinto, de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora es comerciante, vendiendo cosméticos en oficinas de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de una habitación ya que su hija que estaba en otro distrito del país retornó y se ve en la necesidad de espacio para vivir.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria G. lives in a house with an anticrítico loan in the zone of Vino Tinto, in the city of La Paz. She is a merchant, selling cosmetics in offices of the city, income which maintains her. The requested loan is to repair a room. Her daughter, who was in another district of the country, returned and she needs the space to live. This is the third loan that she has solicited a loan and the completed socioeconomic analysis favorably qualifies her and she can access credit.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cost of repairing a room in her house so her daughter can live in it.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
El señor Rene A. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Chapuma, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus tres hijos.
El señor Rene trabaja como albañil en la ciudad de Cochabamba y su esposa es cocinera, con un puesto ambulante, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una loza de hormigón armado para poder construir posteriormente una habitación en planta alta.
Esta es la octava vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Rene A. lives in his own home, in the zone of Chapuma, the peripheral area of the city of La Paz, with his wife and three children. Rene works as a bricklayer in the city of Cochabamba and his wife is a cook with a moving cart, income which maintains their family. The requested loan is for the construction of a reinforced concrete slab to be able to later construct a room upstairs. This is the eighth time that he has solicited a loan and the completed socioeconomic analysis favorably qualifies him and he can access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of constructing of a reinforced concrete slab to later construct a room.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: La Sra. Eusebia, cliente que se encuentra en su cuarta secuencia, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la venta D. edredones y colchas en la mayor parte del tiempo, al margen D. ello tambien se dedica a la venta D. varios productos según las fiestas en las ferias ambulantes, como en Navidad, Año nuevo, carnavales, semana santa etc.Ella tiene 6 hijos pero solo se encarga D. la manutención D. dos que se encuentran en edad escolar ya que los demas estan casados, el esposo es carpintero barnizador que trabaja en una empresa en Achumani, es una cliente responsable y buena, segun referencias D. los vecinos.
texts.en:
Eusebia is in her fourth cycle. She is a small businesswoman who spends most of her time selling comforters and bedspreads. The rest of the time she also sells various products, according to the holidays like Christmas, New Year, Carnival, and Holy Week. She sells these products at street fairs. She has six children, but she is only supporting two. They are school age, and the rest are married. Her husband is a carpenter who varnishes. He works for a company in Achumani. She is a responsible and good client according to her neighbors’ references.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for the end of the year fairs

loans.name: Modinat

texts.en:
Modinat sells cooking oil at retail prices to her customers. Cooking oil is very essential for the preparation of cooked foods in Nigeria. Modinat is a focused hard worker. She is married with three children and she is 40 years old. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. Modinat hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Modinat is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde sells building materials and footballs. With this business, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family. She is 47 years old and married with four children. They live in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. Kehinde is a very hardworking woman. She has been in her business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more building materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Kehinde is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La  Sra. Filomena es cliente que tiene su negocio de una tienda de barrio, tambien se dedica al cultivo de verduras y papa en los terrenos ubicado en Totorani que les dejó su mamá, quien fallecio el año pasado y quien tambien  fue cliente de Emprender. la señora Filomena tiene dos hijos pequeños que se encuentran en en edad escolar, el esposo es albañil que trabaja en Los Pinos, por el momento ella se solventa con el ingreso de la tienda y el salario de su esposo, pero ya por los meses de diciembre, enero hasta mayo ella trae los productos que cosecha para venderlos en el mercado campesino de Chasquipampa, donde tiene un puesto de venta, es una cliente buena y responsable.
texts.en:
Sra. Filomena is a client who runs a neighborhood grocery store. She also grow vegetables and potatoes on farmland located in Totorani. She inherited this property from her mother who passed away last year and was also a client of Emprender. Sra. Filomena has two small children who are in school. Her husband works as a mason in Los Pinos.

For the moment, she is able to cover her expenses with the revenues from her store and her husband’s salary. From the months of December through May, she brings in harvested products to sell at the farmer’s market in Chasquipampa where she has a vendor stall. Sra. Filomena is a good and responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Silvia Yaquelin

texts.es: Silvia, se dedica a la comercialización de productos como el té, flan, gelatinas, refrescos y otros, viene trabajando hace 10 años en el rubro de forma autónoma desde hace 3 años, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo tienen 4 hijos de los cuales 2 trabajan y estudian y los otros 2 solo estudian y dependen de sus padres, los productos que comercializa los trae de la ciudad de La Paz ya que la distribuidora con la que trabajaba la señora Silvia se mudo para esa ciudad y es desde allá que hace traer sus productos. La comercialización de sus productos los realiza en los mercados de La Ramada y Primavera teniendo clientas fijas, también distribuye sus productos en algunas otras provincias como Montero y Guarayos. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ya logro comprarse un terreno donde a construido su modesto hogar. en un futuro quiere que su negocio crezca mucho mas, para lo cual necesitara un vehículo mas grande, actualmente tiene una vagoneta corolla en el cual distribuye todos sus productos con la ayuda de su esposo.
texts.en:
Silvia markets products such as tea, flan, gelatins, soft drinks, and other products. She has been working for 10 years and has managed her own business for the past 3 years with the support of her husband. Silvia has four children; two are working while the other two are students who are still financially dependent.

The products she markets have to be shipped in from the city of La Paz because her distributor moved to that location. Silvia distributes her products at “La Ramada” and “Primavera” Markets, which have established customers. She also distributes her products in some of the other provinces such as Montero and Guarayos. Through the efforts invested into her work, she was able to buy a piece of land where she plans to build a modest home. In the future, she wants to grow her business even more and purchase a larger vehicle. She currently drives a Corolla station wagon to distribute all of her products with the help of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her operating capital

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia vive en casa propia en la C. Baltasar cárdenas de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un hijo; es mujer sola y la actividad que ella realiza es el flete de joyas (ella tiene un stock variado de joyas que se usan para las fiestas populares y las alquila a clientes por un par de días a cambio de cierta cantidad de dinero) y venta de refrescos en su mismo domicilio; con esta actividad ella mantiene a su hijo y puede cubrir sus mínimas necesidades. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, poder comprar más joyas  y mantener estable su negocio.

Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo. Por su calidad de madre soltera y emprendedora y por el carácter social del préstamo ella puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Alicia lives in her own house on Baltasar Cárdenas Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area of the city of La Paz. She has one child. She is a single. Her business is renting jewelry (she has a varied stock of jewelry that is used for the popular holidays, and she rents them to customers for a few days for a certain amount of money). She also sells refreshments from her own home. Through this activity she supports her son and is able to cover the minimal necessities. The loan she is asking for is to increase her capital to be able to buy more jewelry and keep her business stable. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan. She can access a loan because she is a single mother, an entrepreneur, and a person of good character.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more jewelry to rent during the popular holidays

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
El señor Marcelo vive en la calle Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres. Marcelo genera sus ingresos a través de un puesto de Internet el cual esta situado en su mismo domicilio.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar  un servidor y de esta manera mejorar el servicio para sus clientes y también estabilizar su fuente de trabajo.

Esta es la primera vez que recurre a Impro para solicitar un crédito; el carácter social  del crédito y el análisis de su flujo de caja lo habilitan para que pueda acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Marcelo lives in his parents’ house on Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz Street in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. Marcelo gets his income from an Internet stand, which is located in his own home. The loan he is asking for is to buy a server. That way he can improve service for his customers and also stabilize his source of work. This is the first time he has asked Impro for a loan. His good character and the analysis of his cash flow allow him to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a server for his Internet stand

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y dos de sus hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de comida y golosinas en un kiosko instalado en el interior de un colegio nacional de la zona. Todos los días, durante la hora de receso, ofrece diversos platos típicos a los estudiantes, los que son preparados con mucha higiene y salubridad ya que ella es consciente de la confianza que le han brindado los padres de familia y las autoridades del colegio.

La buena sazón y el trato amable con los que Carmen maneja su negocio han hecho que este vaya creciendo por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de golosinas e insumos para la elaboración de comida.

Su más grande anhelo es instalar una bodega en su domicilio. Ella es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada por los que la conocen ya que admiran la responsabilidad con la que realiza su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carmen, 43, lives with her husband and their two children in the Cayaltí district. It is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For one year she has been selling food and sweets in a kiosk, which is inside the national school in the area. Every day during recess she offers various typical dishes to the students. Her food is prepared very hygienically, and it is healthy. She is very aware of the confidence that the parents and the school authorities have in her. Her good seasoning and the kind manner in which Carmen runs her business have made it grow. That is why she is asking Edpyme Alternative, for the first time, for a loan for 1,000 PEN. She plans to buy sweets and supplies to make her food. Her biggest desire is to set up a convenience store in her home. She is a well known woman, and she is held in high esteem by those who know her. They admire the way she runs her business responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets and supplies to make her food

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: La Señora Erika es un cliente nuevo que viene por recomendación de una vecina  que tambien  trabaja con la institucion. La señora Erika vende edredones y aparatos electronicos  a credito con pago diario por la zona de chijipata, kellumani y huayllani, a parte tambien reparte abarrotes cuando recibe pedidos de los vecinos. La señora Erika vive con su esposo Jhobany  que se dedica al transporte publico y ultimamente lo contratan para transportar mercaderia al interior. Juntos tienen tres hijos pequeños y es la señora Erika quien se dedica a cuidarlos, alimentarlos a parte de ir a buscar clientes y cobrar sus deudas. En esta ocacasion  la cliente piensa comprar juguetes en la ciudad de Oruro, aprovechando los precios bajos al por mayor, para salira a venderlos por la zona y por las ferias navideñas.
texts.en:
Erika is a new client. She comes through the recommendation of a neighbor who also works with the institution. Erika sells comforters and electronic apparatus on credit with daily payments. She sells in the areas of Chijipata, Kellumani, and Huayllani. She also sells groceries when she receives orders from her neighbors. Erika lives with her husband, Jhobany. He works in public transportation. Lately he has been hired to transport merchandise to the interior. They have three small children. Erika is the one who is dedicated to taking care of them and feeding them in addition to looking for customers and covering their debts. On this occasion the client is planning to buy toys in the city of Oruro. She will take advantage of the low wholesale prices. She will then sell the toys at the Christmas fairs in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy toys in the city of Oruro for the Christmas holidays

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel vive con su esposa en la calle luis Lara de la zona de San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que el realiza es la de transporte libre ya que tiene un auto con el cual trabaja todos los días para mantener a su familia, la esposa ayuda en el hogar vendiendo verdura en el mercado. El crédito que solicitan es para cubrir los costos de  reparación y mantenimiento de la movilidad

Es cliente antiguo y paga muy bien, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Daniel lives with his wife on Luis Lara Street, in the San Pedro zone of the city of La Paz. His business is taxi service; he has his own vehicle and works every day to support his family. His wife helps with expenses by selling vegetables in the market.

This loan is needed to cover the costs of repair and maintenance for the taxi. Daniel has been a client of the lending institution for a long time and has always paid promptly. For this reason, he qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of taxi

loans.name: Marithza

texts.es:
la sra. Marithza A. O. tiene 41 años de edad, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de pan dulce y blanco, su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion, muy temprano se levanta a comprar el pan en la ciudad de Choluteca y luego lo reparte en diferentes barrios y colonias cercanas donde ella vive, el pan dulce y las galletas son un alimento que se come en el desayuno, muchas personas estan acostumbradas a comer pan dulce con cafe bien caliente por las mañanas, tambien en las tardes se acostumbra a tomar una tasa de cafe con galletas. 
la mayoria de su producto lo vende en las mañanas y por las tardes lo que le queda de las ventas, a veces todo se le vende en las mañanas y por las tardes no tiene que vender, necesita el credito para comprar mas pan y asi tener y poder cumplir con las necesidades de sus clientes.
el pan que vende Marithza lo compran mucho ya que tiene buen sabor es grande y lo mejor de todo que lo vende a un precio justo para los pobladores de la zona en donde ella vive. la mayoria de las personas de esa zona son de escasos recursos economicos.
texts.en:
Marithza A. O. is 41 years old. She has a small business selling sweet bread and white bread that she runs from her home. She gets up very early to buy bread in the city of Choluteca, then sells it in the various neighborhoods near her home.

Sweet breads and cookies are commonly eaten with hot coffee for breakfast, and many people also have a cup of coffee with cookies in the afternoons. Marithza makes most of her sales in the mornings, and sells what is left in the afternoons. Some days, she has no product left to sell in the afternoons.

This loan will be used to buy more bread and so be able to fulfill the needs of her customers. The bread she sells is popular because it is large and tasty, and she sells it at a price that is affordable by her neighbors. Most people in this zone have scarce economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy white bread and sweet bread to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina es casada, tiene 46 años D. edad y vive junto a su esposo y al último D. sus cuatro hijos en el distrito D. Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Gracias a sus ahorros familiares pudo adquirir hace dos años una mototaxi que brinda servicios D. transporte D. carga y pasajeros en la ciudad y los caseríos aledaños. La unidad es manejada por su esposo y constituye la única fuente D. ingreso familiar con la que cuentan.

Debido a los caminos accidentados D. la zona su unidad móvil ha sufrido algunos desperfectos mecánicos. La necesidad por solucionar el problema rápidamente ha hecho que solicite por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales pueda brindarle la reparación y el mantenimiento necesarios para que la mototaxi siga funcionando sin problemas.

Su más granD. anhelo es apoyar a que su hijo termine los estudios D. enfermería que viene realizando en un instituto del lugar. Ella es una madre responsable y que siempre vela por el bienestar D. los suyos.
texts.en:
Maximina is married, 46 years old and lives with her husband and youngest of their 4 children in a district of Cayaltí, located one hour outsiD. Chiclayo.

Thanks to their family savings they were able purchase a mototaxi to proviD. transportation services for passengers and packages in their city and surrounding municipalities. The taxi is driven by her husband and provides their only source of family income.

Due to the rough roads in the city, the taxi has suffered mechanical imperfections. To fix the problem quickly, she has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles with Edpyme Alternativa with which to complete the necessary repairs and maintenance to ensure the mototaxi continues to function without problems.

Her biggest wish is to support hey son in finishing his nursing studies that he is taking in an institute nearby. She is a responsible mother and always has her childrens best interests at heart.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance costs for a mototaxi

loans.name: Lourdes' Group

texts.es: “Alborada”, es el nombre que agrupa una asociación de nueve personas, que se  reúnen en el centro focal Senkata hace más de cuatro años. Entre las tantas actividades que tienen este grupo tenemos a Lourdes A. (presidente de la asociación) que se dedica a la venta de artículos varios de acuerdo a la temporada, anteriormente ella vendía  material escolar, ahora por las fiestas de fin de año necesita comprar adornos y juguetes para venderlos en ferias de la ciudad. Venta que realiza de forma ambulante.  Sus compañeras se dedican a la venta de papa, ropa deportiva, jugos naturales, calzados y otros. En este nuevo ciclo la asociación “Alborada” afirma que necesitan capital para la compra de mercadería, adquiriendo variedad de productos.
texts.en:
"Dawn of day" is the name of a group of nine people that has been meeting in the Senkata regional office for more than four years. Among the numerous activities of the group, the business of Lourdes A. (president of the group) is selling various items according to the season. Previously, she sold school supplies. Now she needs to buy ornaments and toys to sell at city fairs for the end-of-year celebrations. She sells her products as a roving merchant. Her associates sell potatoes, sports clothing, natural juices, footwear, and other items. For this new loan cycle, the Alborada group needs capital to buy merchandise and acquire a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
la sra. Maribel A. A. se dedica a la compra de cerdos para venderlos por pedasos, este negocio es muy bueno ya que muchas personas comen carne de cerdo todos los dias por barato y sabroso.
tambien se dedica a vender chicharrones, con la lonja que le queda del destazo de los cerdos la pone a cocinar y hace los chicharrones, estos los vende por libras.
estando ahi nos dio a probar un chicharron de los que Maribel hace y sabe super sabroso.
ahora necesita un credito para comprar mas cerdos ya que esta temporada de navidad las personas compran los cerdos enteros y se esta quedando sin carne para vender.
texts.en:
Señora Maribel A. A. buys pigs and butchers them to sell the different pieces of meat. This business is very good because many people eat pork products everyday as its cheap and tasty. She also sells pork rinds, with the part of the pigs that is left over. She cooks these and makes pork rinds which she then sells by the pound. While there, she let us try some pork rinds or “chicharon” that she made and they were super tasty. Right now, she needs a loan to buy more pigs as it is the Christmas season and people are buying whole pigs and so she is out of pork to sell.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and butcher them into pieces to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sandra Yaneth

texts.es:
la sra. Sandra L. tiene 34 años de edad, tiene una pequeña pulperia la cual tiene 1 año de haberla iniciado, en estos momentos necesita un credito para poder surtir mas su negocio ya que ahora lo tiene un poco vacio. a tenido problemas durante todo este año pero piensa que con este credito su negocio va a crecer y va a salir adelante.
es casada y vive con su familia, este negocio es su unica fuente de ingresos.
su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, asi atiende a sus clientes durante todo el dia y no descuida a sus hijos.
su meta a corto plazo es poder tener una pulperia bien surtida y grande.
texts.en:
Señora Sandra L. is 34 years old and has a small general store which she opened 1 year ago. She needs a loan right now so she can stock up as the store is a little empty. She has had problems this year but she thinks that with this credit she can grow and move ahead. She is married and lives with her family. This business is her only source of income and is situated in her home. Because of this she can attend to her clients all day and doesn’t have to leave her children. Her goal in the short term is to have a general store that is big and well-stocked.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soaps, candles, matches, lard, oil, margarine, beans, rice, tortillas, bread, sodas, pills, instant soaps, salt and condiments

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: José Americo

texts.es:
EL Sr. José Américo C. A. tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su hijo en Ica y trabaja en el Centro Comercial Amazonas (es una asociación de trabajadores que anteriormente eran ambulantes) esto queda en la Calle Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de cebada,chicha, jugos extractos y otros desde hace mas de 20 años empezando primero con su esposa quien en la actualidad no vive con él pero el Sr. continuó con el trabajo hasta la actualidad. Es su principal fuente de ingreso el cual le a permitido lograr que sus hijos salgan adelante.
Solicita que lo apoyemos en esta campaña navideña para poder invertir en la compra de adornos y luces navideñas para poder así obtener un mejor ingreso que le permita cubrir mejor sus gastos personales.
El tiene buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos y los socios del centro comercial donde trabaja.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Americo C. A. is 55 years old and lives with his son at 557 A Pimentel Street in Ica. He works at the Amazonas Shopping Center (this is an association of workers who were previously street vendors) which is located on Lambayeque Street. He is in the business of selling barley water, purple corn drink, fresh juices, and more. He has been in this business for more than 20 years, initially with his wife. She is currently no longer living with him, but he continues in this work up to the present date. This is his primary source of income and has allowed him to attain the success of his children. He requests our assistance so that this Christmas season he can invest in the purchase of Christmas ornaments and lights in order to obtain an income that will better allow him to cover his personal expenses. He has good references from his neighbors and from his associates at the shopping center where he works.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest for the Christmas season

loans.name: Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
Sartasiñani” es el nombre elegido por este grupo de nueve socias que han dedicado ya gran parte de su vida al comercio de todo tipo de mercadería según la temporada, lo que hace que la proximidad de las fiestas de fin de año, se convierta en una gran oportunidad de generar importantes recursos para ellas y sus familias.
Tienen un  compromiso con la institución demostrando responsabilidad, están seguros que lograran realizar una buena inversión en sus rubros para beneficio y mejora de la calidad de vida  de todas ellas y sus familias.El grupo en su totalidad comprara mercaderia.
texts.en:
Sartasiñani is the name chosen by this group of nine members who have dedicated part of their lives to the trade of all kinds of seasonal merchandise. The coming Holiday Season is a great opportunity to generate income for the members and their families.

They have a commitment with the institution and have shown themselves to be responsible. They are certain that they will make a good investment in the items they plan to purchase. Their aim is to improve their quality of life and that of their families. The group will use the total of the loan to purchase inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF INVENTORY

loans.name: Auner Sarvelio

texts.es:
el joven Auner Sarvelio C. tiene 20 años de edad, se dedica a la molienda de maiz, todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes.
este negocio es muy bueno ya que muchas personas prefieren moler maiz y hacer ellos mismos la masa que comprar hecha la harina de maiz.
la mayoria de sus clientes son mujeres que se dedican a la produccion y venta de tortillas como negocio.
ahora Auner necesita comprar repuestos para darle mantenimiento a su molino y tambien necesita comprar unas mesas.
el tiene muchos clientes fijos que llegan todos los dias a su negocio.
esta muy feliz ya que a su corta edad ya emprendio el camino del negocio, su meta a corto plazo es tener unos molinos mas y dar empleo a dos personas para que le ayuden a atender a sus clientes, con esto atrae mas clientes y tiene mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Auner Sarvelio C. is 20 years old and devotes himself to milling corn. Every day he gets up very early to attend to his customers. This business is very good since many people prefer buying milled corn and making their own dough rather than buying it pre-prepared. The majority of his customers are women who run businesses that are dedicated to the production and sale of tortillas. Auner currently needs to buy spare parts for his mill so he can maintain its condition as well as purchase some tables for his business. He has many regular customers who come to his business every day. He is very happy since at his young age he has already launched the beginnings of his business. His short term goal is to get some more mills and hire two employees to help him attend to the customers. With this expansion, the business will attract more customers and more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of replacement parts for his corn mill

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía es una madre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 06 y 11 años de edad en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de seis meses es propietaria de un pequeño taller de carpintería ubicado en su domicilio. La idea de este negocio surgió debido a la necesidad de brindarle a su familia un sustento más permanente ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para mantener la economía familiar.

Ella atiende el taller junto a su hermano y trabajan en base a pedidos. El trabajo que realizan es de muy buena calidad por lo que su clientela ha ido aumentando. Lucía no cuenta con el capital suficiente para seguir atendiendo los pedidos de sus clientes por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de madera.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir adelante con su taller y comprar maquinaria para hacer la producción más eficiente. Ella es una mujer bastante activa, responsable y creativa.
texts.en:
Lucia is a 46 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children (age 6 and 11) in the district of Cayaltí, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has managed a small carpentry shop at her home for the past six months. The idea for this business came about as a result of her need to provide her family with a steadier source of income. Her husband works as a farm laborer and his earnings are not sufficient to maintain the family financially.

Lucia manages the workshop with her brother and they work based on the orders they receive. Their products are of very good quality and have resulted in an increase in customers. Lucia does not have sufficient capital to continue fulfilling her customers’ requests, so she has requested her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles to buy wood.

Her greatest dreams are to have continued success with her workshop and purchase machinery to make production more efficient. Lucia is an active, responsible, and creative woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Brisas De Nacaome Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario denominado las brisas de nacaome, esta integrado por tres personas un varon y dos damas, quienes se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo, ellos venden sus productos en el mercado municipal de Nacaome Valle
 
el señor Eulalio C. es padre de 5 hijos, esta casado con Maria Teodora B., quien le ayuda a vender las frutas y verduras en su puesto cuando el viaja a tegucigalpa a comprar, con la ayuda de este negocio han salido adelante y han criado a sus hijos , aunque aun tienen 2 pequeños, esta solicitando el credito para poder surtir un poco mas su negocio.
 
la señora Marcelina B. es viuda, es madre de dos hijos ya mayores, uno de ellos esta en estados unidos y el otro vive en otra ciudad, se dedica al servicio de moler maiz en su molino. En las tardes sale a vender ropa usada en los barrios cercanos a su domicilio, esta solicitando el credito para poder reparar uno de sus molinos. 
 
la señora Lidia B. es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos pequeños y se dedica a la venta de sandalias, zapatos y otras prendas de vestir en su puesto ubicado en las afueras del mercado municipal de Nacaome, esta actividad le ha servido para salir adelante con sus hijos, su deseo es terminar de contruir su casa. Esta solicitando el credito para poder surtir un poco mas su inventario, ya que en la epoca de navidad las ventas suben.
texts.en:
The solidarity group called “Las Brisas de Nacaome” (The Breezes of Nacaome) consists of three people, one man and two women. They have known each other a long time and sell their products at the city market in Nacome Valley.

Sr. Eulalio C. is the father of five children and married to Sra. Maria Teodora B.. His wife sells fruits and vegetables from their vending stand while he travels to Tegucigalpa to buy the inventory. With the help of this business, they have been able to move forward and raise their children of whom two are still young. He is requesting this loan so that he can restock his business a bit more.

Sra. Marcelina B. is a widow and the mother of two grown children. One of them is in the United States while the other lives in another city. She has a grain mill and offers services to grind corn. In the afternoons, she sells used clothing in the poor neighborhoods near her home. She is requesting a loan so that she can repair one of her milling machines.

Sra. Lidia B. is a single mother with three small children. She sells sandals, shoes, and clothing from her vending post on the outskirts of the Nacaome Municipal Market. This business has allowed her children to get ahead. Lidia hopes to finish the construction of her house. She is requesting a loan to purchase a little more inventory because her sales go up during the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lily

texts.es:
Lily es una madre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 14 y 13 años de edad en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace ocho años tiene instalado en su casa un negocio de venta de productos de belleza y losería. Ella nos comenta que la idea del negocio surgió debido a que los ingresos que percibe su esposo trabajando como obrero agrícola no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio ha ido creciendo gracias al buen trato con el que Lily atiende a sus clientes. Ella está pensando en ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de belleza debido a la campaña navideña pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción por lo que está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es poder brindarle a sus dos hijos una educación de calidad con la cual se aseguren un buen futuro. Ella es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Lily is a 41 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children (ages 14 and 13) in the house of her parents, which is located in the district of Cayaltí and an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Eight years ago, Lily established a business in her home selling beauty products and earthenware. She says that the idea for this business came about because her husband’s earnings from his job as a farm worker are not enough to cover their family’s expenses.

Her business has grown thanks to the good service Lily provides to her customers. She is thinking about expanding her business by purchasing more beauty products for the Christmas season. However, she does not have sufficient capital in order to take action. Therefore she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

Her greatest desire is to provide her two children with a quality education that will assure them of a good future. Lily is a cheerful and hardworking woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to sell for the Christmas season

loans.name: Irma Deysi

texts.es:
la sra. Irma Deysi M. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en el Triunfo Choluteca, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia que esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion.
Irma desea comprar mas mercaderia ya que los carros repartidores llegan solo una vez por semana y a veces el producto se le termina rapido, vive en triunfo y es un poco retirado, a veces tiene que esperar muchos dias para poder comprar mas mercaderia.
se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio le esta dejando buenas ganancias las cuales las esta invirtiendo en su hogar.
tambien desea hacer mas grande su pulperia para dar una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
esta es su unica fuente de ingresos, Irma piensa que con este credito que esta solicitando su negocio va a crecer un poco mas.
texts.en:
Irma Deysi M. is 49 years old. She lives in Triunfo Choluteca and sells common household products; she has a neighborhood store located in her house. Irma wishes to buy more merchandise. The delivery trucks only arrive once a week and sometimes she sells her inventory very quickly. She lives in Triunfo and is retired, so she often has to wait many days to buy more merchandise. Irma is happy that her business earns good income, which she is investing in her home. She also hopes to expand her store to provide better customer service. The store is her only source of income. Irma believes this loan will help her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of eggs, rice, potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, butter, margarine, oil, lard, soap, candles, batteries, candy, churros, soups, pastas, razors, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, maize flour and wheat seasoning, sweets.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 64 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales sólo uno vive con ella. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Por más D. 20 años se ha dedicado a la venta D. verduras en los exteriores del mercado D. Cayaltí. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a la economía D. su hogar ya que su esposo actualmente recibe una pensión D. jubilación que no es suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares. Ella nos cuenta que empieza desD. muy temprano en la mañana comprando las verduras a los distribuidores mayoristas para luego ofrecérselas a sus clientes durante el día.

Margarita desea comprar más verduras para satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes pero no pueD. comprar algunas variedades debido a que están a un precio muy elevado y el capital con el que cuenta no es suficiente para adquirirlas. Por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más granD. anhelo es ver convertido a su hijo en un buen profesional por lo que desea brindarle un buena educación. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y muy solidaria con sus familiares y conocidos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 64 years old, married, and has 6 children. Of these only one lives with her. She lives with her family in the Cayalti district, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than 20 years she has been in the business of selling vegetables on the outskirts of the Cayalti market. This endeavor allows her to help her household economy since her husband currently receives a retirement pension which is insufficient for covering the family expenses. She tells us that she starts very early in the morning buying vegetables from the wholesale distributors in order to offer them to her clients during the day.

Margarita wishes to buy more vegetables in order to satisfy the demand from her clients, but she can’t buy some varieties because their price is too high and she lacks sufficient capital to acquire them. This is why she finds herself for the first time applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN.

Her greatest desire is to see her son become a good professional, and so she wishes to proviD. him with a good education. She is a hard-working woman who is very devoted to her family and acquaintances.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables in order to expand business

loans.name: Damian

texts.es:
el señor Damian L. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos estudian y uno de ellos aprende el oficio de mecanica en su taller.
Su familia es de principios cristianos el trabaja a tiempo completo en su taller de mecanica automotriz.
 
en su negocio repara carros pequeños y grandes, su especialidad es los motores, bombas de inyeccion , cambio de hojas de resorte y calibracion de valvulas.
 
esta solicitando el credito para la compra de un torquimetro, llaves, gatas y un tecle.
texts.en:
Damian L. is 49. He is in a common law marriage, and he has three children. Two of them go to school, and one is learning the job of mechanic in his shop. His family is of Christian principles. He works full time in his automotive mechanic's shop. In his business he repairs small and large cars. His specialties are motors, fuel injection, changing shock absorbers, and valve calibrations. He is asking for the loan to buy a torque gauge, wrenches, jacks, and a grip hoist.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools and accessories for cars

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luis Crecencio

texts.es: El Sr. Crecencio  vive por la zonas de los lotes, junto con su esposa y sus 3 hijos , los cuales estan en colegio. El Sr Crecencio se animo a sacar credito solo con  emprender, ya que no cuenta con ninguna otra deuda, cuenta  con un vehiculo toyota noah modelo 1996 con lo cual trabaja tramsportando pasajeros Santa Cruz -Cbba. Lo cual le permite sostener a su familia y algo de ahorro, La famila cuenta con casa propia  que lograron con el fruto de su esfuerzo . llego a nuestra institucion solicitando financiamiento para el arreglo de su vehiculo " compra de cremallera" y la compra de un televisor para sus hijos . Don Crecencio se ha propuesto sacar profesionales a sus hijos, para que puedan tener un buen nivel de vida y para eso el y su esposa  estan trabajando con esmero.
texts.en:
Mr. Crecencio lives in the area of Los Lotes with his wife and three children. The children go to school. Mr. Crecencio decided to get a loan only from Emprender. He has no other debt. He has a Toyota vehicle, Noah model 1996, which he uses for work transporting passengers between Santa Cruz and Cochabamba. This allows him to support his family and save a bit. The family has their own house that they obtained as the fruit of their efforts. He came to our institution asking for a loan to fix his vehicle, buy a rack, and buy a television for his children. Mr. Crecencio proposes to have his children become professionals so that they can have a good level of life. To do this, he and his wife are working very hard.
