Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Dios Proveera 1,2,3,5 Group

texts.en:
L.OrcilLL.. L.isL. L.theL. L.coordinatorL. L.ofL. L.herL. L.groupL., L.DiosL. L.PoveeraL. (L.GodL. L.willL. L.proviDL..), L.andL. L.herL. L.storyL. L.isL. L.representativeL. L.ofL. L.herL. L.groupL. loans.use: Rice, pants, underwear and deodorant

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
el señor Juan Jose E. tiene 56 años de edad, vive en union libre con su pareja la señora Rosa Lainez con quien tiene 8 hijos, todos estan casados y no dependen de ellos. Su esposa tambien vende  verduras y refrescos en su casa.
 
el señor E. quien se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado mayoreo de Tegucigalpa los fines de semana y los dias de semana vende su producto en barrios, colonias de Nacaome y San Lorenzo.
el carro con que transporta sus verduras es propio.
 
esta solicitando el credito para invetir mas en su negocio ya que debido a la epoca navideña la demanda de frutas y verduras es mayor.
 
su meta a corto plazo es tener un puesto estable de verduras en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
texts.en:
Juan Jose E. is 56 years old and lives with his partner Rosa Lainez, with whom he has 8 children. All of his children are married and financially independent. His wife sells vegetables and soft drinks from their home.

On the weekends, E. sells vegetables in Tegucigalpa's wholesale market. On weekdays, he sells his merchandise in the residential areas of Nacaome and San Lorenzo. The car that he uses to transport his vegetables is his own.

He is requesting a loan to invest in his business, since the Christmas season means increased demand for fruits and vegetables. His short-term goal is to have an established produce stand in San Lorenzo's municipal market.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bananas, onions, tomatoes, potatoes, green bananas, limes, oranges, and carrots

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.es:
el señor Carlos Roberto E. tiene 25 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene una hija de 03 años, su pàreja es ama de casa. Carlos tiene su taller de mecanica en donde repara motores, hojas de resorte, frenos, mantenimientos y mucho mas para vehiculos livianos y pesados.
 
esta solicitando el prestamo para compra de una gata, caja de herramientas, aceite, filtros y repuestos para carros.
en esta epoca de navidad muchas personas le dan mantenimiento a sus vehiculos y esta es la oportunidad de ganarse un poco mas de dinero.
el desea darle todo lo mejor a su hija que es lo mas importante que tiene en la vida. dice que el va a trabajar toda la vida para darle lo mejor a su hijita.
texts.en:
Carlos Roberto E. is 25 years old and has a 3-year-old daughter with his common-law wife, who is a homemaker. Carlos has an automobile repair shop where he works on engines, suspensions, and brakes, and provides routine maintenance for lightweight and heavy vehicles.

He is asking for a loan to purchase a tool box, oil, filters, and replacement parts. During the Christmas season, many people want to have their cars serviced, and this presents an opportunity to earn more money.

Carlos wants to provide the very best for his daughter, and he plans to work hard his whole life to accomplish this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools, oil, filters, hoses, clamps, and spare parts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos Group

texts.en:
Ninita is the coordinator of her group Unidos Venceremos (United we will overcome), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in an agricultural community based around the sugarcane industry on the outskirts of La Romana, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their four children.

Ninita is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans without problems. She plans to use this loan to invest in her "colmado" (a small corner store which sells the basic necessities) by purchasing rice, beans, sugar and soda to sell to her clients. She will use the profits to continue investing in her business, with the goal of creating a larger more sustainable business that will provide a steady stream of income for her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Rice, sugar, flour, soda and beans to sell in her cornerstore

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del  Banco Comunal “3 D. Mayo”, vive en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 75 años D. edad y es viuda. Se dedica a la compra y venta D. abarrotes. 

El grado D. instrucción D. la señora Rosa es primaria completa y tiene 4 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 4 años.  Su primer préstamo fue D.  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra D. chanchos y gallinas.

Ella solicitará un préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  D. abarrotes como: azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda en su casa para así ya no ir al mercado.

Lo que mas le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Rosa is a partner of "3 D. Mayo" Community Bank and lives in the Llave District, El Collao Province, in the Department of Puno. She is 75 years old and is a widow. She buys and sells groceries. She has completed elementary school and has 4 children.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles to purchase pigs and chickens.

She is requesting a loan for 2,500 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of groceries such as sugar, rice and noodles.

Her wish for the future is to have a store in her home so that she wouldn't have to go to the market.

What she likes the most about her Community Bank are the savings and the meetings.


Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF INVENTORY

loans.name: Tulia

texts.es:
Tulia M. es una socia dinámica y trabajadora, vive en el distrito D. Calleria región D. Ucayali, tiene 55 años, es viuda, madre D. cuatro hijos, todos mayores D. edad.
Tulia se dedica a la venta D. pollos, paralelamente, atienD. una pequeña bodega instalada en su propia casa.
Tulia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Fray Martín D. Porres” desD. hace nueve años. El primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que invirtió en la venta D. pollos. 
Actualmente requiere un crédito D. 3000 soles que será utilizado en la compra D. productos comestibles para su bodega como arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. La meta D. Tulia es ser distribuidora D. gaseosas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Tulia M., 55, has been a dynamic and hard working member of the “Fray Martín D. Porres” communal bank for 9 years. She lives in the Calleria district, Ucayali region. She has four adult children. She sells chickens and also tends to a small grocery store in her home. He first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy chickens. She currently needs 3000 soles to buy food items such as, rice, sugar, pasta, etc. for her store. Tulia's ultimate goal is to be a wholesale soft-drink distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items (rice, sugar, pasta, etc) to stock her store.

loans.name: Delicia Pilar

texts.es: Delicia Pilar es una mujer emprendedora que lucha por alcanza sus ideales, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 36 años de edad,  ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, que funciona en su casa, esta actividad lo realiza diariamente para ello se levanta muy temprano para tender en su tienda, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él se dedica al comercio. Pilar forma parte del Banco Comunal “De la Amistad” desde hace once años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue utilizado para comprar gaseosas. Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 700 soles, que será utilizado para comprar productos comestibles como fideos, azúcar, gaseosas, detergente, aciete, etc. para ser vendidos a sus clientes. La meta de Pilar es implementar su tienda con diferentes artículos de ferretería, escritorio y del hogar.
texts.en:
Delicia Pilar, 36, is an enterprising woman who struggles to reach her ideals. She lives in Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She runs a grocery store from her home. She tends to it daily so she rises very early to open her store. Her husband, who is a merchant, supports her efforts. Pilar has been a member of the "De la Amistad" communal bank for 11 years. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy soft-drinks. She now needs a 700 sol loan to buy stock items like pasta, sugar, soft-drinks, detergent, oil, etc. to sell to her customers. Pilar's goal is to stock her store with different types of articles like hardware, office and household supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items like pasta, sugar, soft-drinks, detergent, oil, etc.

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.en: Ramon's business is buying and selling cattle to nearby farms. He began 22 years ago when he sold two calves that he had inherited. Ramon is married and has a 19 year old who is working, but he says that he is having a very difficult time. His economic situation is quite poor. He says that he often has to skip meals because his situation is so difficult. Ramon says that the problem is that he has little working capital but he hopes to change this. He is committed to honoring his debts and commitments. Ramon has an excellent credit history with Fundación Leon 2000.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Dionisia Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Dionisia Consuelo O. se dedica a vender en su pulpería los productos de granos básicos los que son comercializados por ella misma a diario con el fin de abastecer las necesidades de su familia y por ende de su negocio. Ella se ha destacado por ser una fiel trabajadora que logra la manera de satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar.
Actualmente ella solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de los granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, entre otros para continuar con su actividad que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Dionisia Consuelo O. has a small grocery store where she sells staple grains that she markets herself with the goal of meeting the needs of her family and her business. She stands out as being a hard worker who succeeds in satisfying her household's needs.

Dionisia is currently requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of staples including rice, beans, and sugar, so that she can continue her business, which is greatly in need of support.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of staple goods

loans.name: Mayra Concepcion

texts.en: Mayra opened her beauty shop seven years ago because she recognized that there was a great demand for these services and it could be a profitable business. She will use her loan to buy cosmetics and products that she needs for styling hair. Mayra has a good credit history with Fundación León 2000 and she says that her loans have been of help in supporting her business. Mayra says that cosmetics sales have been slow lately. Mayra’s dream is to build her own house. She isn’t married and has two children, ages six and nine.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and hair styling products

loans.name: Martha Esperanza

texts.es:
la señora Martha Esperanza E. G. tiene 37 años de edad es madre de tres hijos y vive en union libre con el sr. Mario Gomez Duron quien se dedica a la construccion.
doña Marta se dedica a la venta de ropa usada para dama y caballero, la ropa para niños es nueva. Su producto lo vende en la comunidad del Jicaro Galan Nacaome Valle
 
esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas ropa ya que tiene muchos encargos para la epoca de navidad, su producto lo vende al credito.
su maximo deseo es graduar a sus hijos de la universidad y que sean buenos profesionales, es lo que desea para lo que mas quiere en su vida.
texts.en:
Martha Esperanza E. G. is 37 years old, the mother of three children, and lives with her common-law husband Mario Gomez Duron, who is a construction worker.

Marta sells used clothing for adults and new clothing for children. She sells her products in the Jicaro Galan Nacaome Valle neighborhood.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing, since she has many orders for the Christmas season and sells her merchandise on credit. Her biggest dream in life is to see her children graduate from college and become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new clothes for children and used clothes for adults

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Isaura Margarita

texts.es:
En el mercado la Terminal del departamento de León, la señora Isaura T. se dedica arduamente a atender su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras las que son comercializadas por ella misma ofreciendo sandías, mangos, mandarinas, chiltomas, tomates y otros productos perecederos.
Ella tiene dos hijos a su cargo a los que les debe de proporcionar los estudios y es por este motivo que busca la manera de cómo obtener el capital económico para brindarle las condiciones para su desarrollo y por esto es que se esfuerza en la venta de las frutas y verduras para obtener dicho capital y así continuar mejorando su condición.
texts.en:
At the Terminal Market in the department of León, Sra. Isaura T. works hard at her business selling fruit and vegetables. She offers watermelons, mangoes, tangerines, bell peppers, tomatoes, and other perishable products.

Isaura has two dependent children and is responsible for their educational expenses. For this reason, she looks for ways to obtain financial capital so that she can provide the conditions needed for their development. Therefore, she strives to sell fruits and vegetables to generate income for improving their condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El señor Rubén V. O. tiene 53 años de edad, habita en un barrio de escasos recursos económicos que no cuenta con la seguridad y la higiene necesaria para brindarle a sus habitantes, el cual es llamado “Barrio Laureles Norte”, él es casado y con su esposa tienen un pequeño negocio hace 11 años, el cual es una venta de abarrotes “pulperia”, ellos tienen una hija de 10 años de edad, actualmente cursa la escuela primaria, desean solicitar este préstamo para poder invertirle a su negocio y de esta manera obtengan una mayor generación de ingresos que a largo se traduzca a un cambio optimo en su nivel de vida, pues ellos ansían que su hija logre culminar sus estudios profesionales y  se convierta en una ciudadana de bien en esta sociedad.
texts.en:
Señor Rubén V. O. is 53 years old and lives in a low-income neighborhood called "Barrio Laureles Norte," where the residents lack adequate security and hygiene. He is married and he and his spouse have had a small business for 11 years, which is a small grocery store. They have a daughter who is 10 years old who is currently in primary school. They wish to take out this loan to invest in their business, so that they can generate a higher income that will lead to a positive change in their standard of living. They yearn for their daughter to attain a successful professional education and become a good citizen in this society.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products for the grocery store

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras 1 Group

texts.en:
Dorotea plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling used clothing. She buys large packages of used clothing shipped to the Dominican Republic from the United States and then sells them in her community.

Dorotea is the coordinator of her group, Las Trabajadoras (The Workers), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the slums that ring Santo Domingo, an urban area where crime is high. Running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her family.

Dorotea is excited to be taking her second loan after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and for savings to build upon her very small base of possessions. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy packages of used clothing in bulk to sell

loans.name: Rosalpina Del Carmen

texts.en: Rosalpina has four grown children who are all independent of her and she is not married. For nearly thirty years her business has been the sale of baked goods and vegetables. Rosalpina says that this has been her business because she loves to cook. The vegetables that she sells vary from season to season and the baked goods she sells include a kind of shortbread cookie called "rosquillas" and a pastry with a cheese filling called "hornados." Rosalpina dreams of being able to afford repairs to her house. Rosalpina is an excellent client of Fundación León 2000, but she reports that her sales have been low and she has clients who are behind in their payments.

loans.use: Working capital for her business

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, uno de 19 años de edad y dos gemelos de 6 años. Vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis meses se dedica a la venta por catálogo de café elaborado, todos los días recorre la ciudad de Cayaltí y sus caseríos ofreciendo su producto. Ella nos cuenta que esta iniciativa nació debido a que su esposo trabaja como chofer de transporte público y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para solventar los ingresos familiares.

Su esfuerzo diario está teniendo resultados y sus clientes están aumentando. Rosa desea adquirir su propio sotck de café y poder garantizar una atención inmediata a sus clientes pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar su objetivo por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande es ver a su hijo mayor estudiando una carrera profesional con la que pueda asegurarse un futuro próspero. Ella es una mujer amable, carismática y muy entregada a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 42 years old, she is married with three children, a 19 years old one and two 6 years old twins. She lives in Cayaltí district, one hour away from the town of Chiclayo.

Since six months ago she sells manufactured coffee by catalog. Every day she covers Cayaltí town and the surrounding hamlets offering her product. She tells us that this initiative was born because her husband works as a public transport driver and his income is not enough to cover the expenses of the family.

Her daily effort is bearing fruit and the number of her clients is increasing. Rosa wishes to purchase her own stock of coffee and to be able to guarantee her clients her immediate attention but she lacks the necessary capital to achieve her goal, so she finds herself for the first time in the position of having to ask a credit of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa [Edpyme Alternative].

Her greatest wish is to see her older son study a professional degree with which he can be assured of a prosperous future. She is a kind woman, charismatic, and very dedicated to her work.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coffee by catalog to expand her business

loans.name: Isidra De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Isidra R. es una dama muy trabajadora que se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de frutas y bebidas como gaseosas, agua y jugos todo esto comercializado en su pequeño local donde atiende a diario en el departamento de León en la estación de buses donde llegan muchas personas.
La razón por la que ella solicita el crédito es porque requiere de inmediato adquirir las frutas como lo son bananos y también comprar las bebidas como son gaseosas, agua y jugos para continuar comercializándolos en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Ms. Isidra R. is a very hard-working lady, dedicated to tending her business, selling fruits and soft drinks such as soda pops, water and juices. All this is marketed in her small business premises where every day she serves her clients. Her business is located in the department of León, in the bus station, to which a lot of people arrive.

The reason why she asks for this loan is because she needs to purchase fruits such as bananas and also to buy drinks such as soda pops, water and juices immediately to continue marketing them in her establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks and fruits

loans.name: Linda Rosa

texts.es:
la señora Linda Rosa E. G. tiene 51 años de edad, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a la venta de hamacas de cañamo, ropa nueva y usada. Los domingos vende golosinas y refrescos en el campo de futbol de su comunidad en Jicaro Galan, esta casada con el señor Santos Pedro Mayorga con quien procreo 4 
hijos todos ellos ya estan adultos. 
Linda junto a su esposo realizan las actividades de compra y venta de los productos antes mencionados, esta solicitando el credito para poder hacer crecer su negocio, desea comprar varias hamacas y ropa para venderlas en navidad, en esta zona se venden mucho las hamacas ya que es una zona en la cual el clima es alto, mucha calor, y las personas prefieren acostarse en hamacas que en camas por ser mas frescas.
se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio le genera ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Ms. Linda Rosa E. G. is 51 years old. For the past 7 years she has sold hemp hammocks and new and used clothes. On Sundays she sells candy and soft drinks at her community's soccer field in Jicaro Galan. She is married to Mr. Santos Pedro Mayorga, with whom she has 4 children, all of them already grown up.

Linda, along with her husband, purchases and sells the mentioned products. She asks for the loan in order to expand her business. She wishes to purchase several hammocks and clothes to sell them in Christmas. In this area hammocks are easily sold as it is an area of hot climate, where it is very warm, and people prefer to lie in hammocks rather than in beds, because they are cooler.

She feels very happy because her business generates an income for her to support her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for men and women and hammocks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Patricia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señorita  PATRICIA ELIZABETH B. R. tiene 19 años, vive en el distrito del PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia  es soltera y actualmente se encuentra cursando el 4to ciclo de la carrera de Ingeniería Agro Industrial en la Universidad. Desde pequeña, hasta la actualidad, se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de  golosinas como: galletas, chocolates, chicles, caramelos, cigarrillos, gaseosas, etc. Con el dinero obtenido colabora económicamente en su hogar y cubre sus propios gastos personales y de sus estudios.
Este es su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles el cual lo utilizará para la compra de golosinas como: galletas, chicles, caramelos, chocolates, cigarrillos, gaseosas, etc. para estar abastecida y poder continuar con sus ventas. 
Ella sueña con tener su tienda de comestibles en su  domicilio para lo cual esta ahorrando y trabajando arduamente.
texts.en:
Miss Patricia Elizabeth B. R. is 19 years old. She lives in the district of Porvenir, part of Trujillo provence in the La Libertad region of Peru. She is single and is currently in her fourth year of an Agroindustrial Engineering major at the university. Since she was small until the present, she has operated a convenience stand, selling such items as cookies, chocolates, gum, candy, cigarettes, soda, etc. With the money earned, she contributes to her household, covering her personal expenses and studies.

This is her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles, which she will use to buy merchandise such as cookies, chocolates, gum, candies, cigarettes, sodas, etc. to be stocked and to be able to continue with her sales.

She dreams of having a grocery store in her home, for which she is saving and working hard.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Kurten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products such as  cookies, chocolates, gum, candies, cigarettes, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Maric

texts.en:
Maric began selling gasoline four years ago because there was no business that provided fuel in her immediate area. Before she started her business, people had to drive a distance to one of the bigger cities. Maric says that the business continues to grow, even though more competition has arisen and now there is a gas station in the area. She says that she has built up a good customer base and her customers are loyal and, for various reasons, her business continues to grow. The dangerous nature of her work worries Maric, and she dreams of opening her own small general store to complement her fuel sales business.

Maric is married and has two children, ages 7 and 4. She says that they are very lucky to be healthy, to have a roof over their heads, and to have food to eat.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela es socia del  Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 29 años de edad y está casada. Tiene una panadería. 

La señora Graciela tiene grado de instrucción secundaria completa y tiene 3 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 9 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de insumos para la panadería.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de harina, manteca, azúcar, leña, y todos los ingredientes para la elaboración de sus productos.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener su casa propia y maquinaria para su panadería.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las charlas
texts.en:
Mrs. Graciela is a member of the “Third of May” Community Bank. She lives in the “Llave” District, in El Collao Province, in the Department of Puno. She is twenty-nine years old and married. She has a bakery. Mrs. Graciela has completed her secondary education and she has three children. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for nine years. Her first loan was for $300.00 new soles. She used this money to buy supplies for her bakery. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 new soles that she will use to buy flour, butter, sugar, wood and other ingredients that she needs to make her products. Her future desire is to have her own house and machinery for her bakery. What she most likes about the community bank are their savings and their informational talks.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy butter, sugar, wood, etc.

loans.name: María Elisa

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, específicamente en el mercado La Terminal, la señora María Elisa L. se dedica a laborar en su establecimiento de venta de güirilas y elotes ofreciéndolos diariamente en su establecimiento a partir de las cuatro de la mañana hasta el atardecer.
Es de importancia destacar que ella ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su negocio con mucho ahínco y la razón por la que está solicitando el crédito es para comrprar el maíz para hacer las güirilas y a la vez vender los elotes. También lo invertirá para la compra de frutas como manzanas, uvas y bananos para continuar ofertándolos en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the area of Leon, specifically in the Terminal Market, Maria Elisa L. works selling local snacks known as guirilas and elotes (roasted corn and tortillas). Maria runs her small stand in the market from 4 in the morning until evening. It's important to highlight that she has managed to grow her business with a lot of hard work. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy the corn she needs to make the snacks. She would also like to purchase fruit, such as apples, grapes and bananas to sell from her stand as well.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn for the local snacks she makes and sells, as well as various fruit to offer her customers.

loans.name: Alma Ruth

texts.es:
la señora Alma Ruth C. tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, uno de 4 y una de 8 años, trabaja desde hace 8 años en la venta de golosinas, refrescos, jugos y todo tipo de alajas enchapadas en oro, las golosinas y demas alimentos los comercializa en su domicilio, con la ayuda de su mama doña Ofelia F. de 65 años de edad, es su madre quien le ayuda y le cuida el negocio cuando
su hija va a la ciudad de pespire a vender las joyas, juntas trabajan con el objetivo de sacar adelante la familia, Alma  esta solicitando el credito para surtir su negocio y poder aprovechar la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Alma Ruth C. is 33 years old and the single mother of 2 children, 4 and 8 years old. For the last 8 years she has worked selling sodas, sweet drinks, juices, and all kinds of local snacks. She prepares the sweet drinks and the snacks in her home with the help of her mother, Ofelia F., who is 65 years old. Ofelia helps Alma and takes care of the business when Alma needs to go to the city. They are working together to help improve the quality of life for their family. Alma is requesting a loan to stock up her business for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sodas, juices, chickens, meat and other things she needs to stock her store for the Christmas season.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lesbia Maria

texts.en: Lesbia is a widow and mother of three children. Her eldest children are 30 and 27 and are independent of their mother; the youngest is 21 and is in school. Lesbia began her business when her husband passed away and she needed to find a way to support herself. She started by selling clothing and then included food sales, which she sells to a preschool. The two aspects of her business ensure that she has a steady income. This is the first business loan that Lesbia has taken out with Fundación León 2000, though she has a good credit history with them for personal use loans. Lesbia’s dream is to continue to use her business to support her daughter’s education. Lesbia says that the challenge of being both mother and father to her three daughters is great.

loans.use: Working capital for her business

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena C. es una persona muy esforzada que se ha dedicado por ocho años al negocio de venta de calzados centrando sus ventas en el calzado para damas ofreciéndolos en el mercado la Terminal donde diario los ofrece y es visitada por sus clientes.
La razón por la que ha acudido a Ceprodel es para realizar un crédito para la compra de los calzados y de esta manera continuar comercializándolos y contribuir al desarrollo de su negocio y por ende de su familia en el departamento de León.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena C. is a strong and hardworking person. For 8 years she has worked selling women's shoes from the Terminal Market, running her business and serving her customers every day. She is working with the organization Ceprodel so that she can purchase more shoes and continue to grow her business, and in turn help provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for her business, and continue to increase her sales and income.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel R. se dedica a la actividad de transporte selectivo por medio de su taxi que a diario maneja en el departamento de León siendo esta actividad la que le permite adquirir el capital para invertirlo en el bienestar de su familia.
A diario lleva a cabo el trabajo en el taxi llevando a las personas de un lugar a otro y hoy en día ha luchado más por mejorar su actividad y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito porque necesita invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus tres hijos que tiene y para ello requiere reconstruir la vivienda que por mucho tiempo ha estado en malas condiciones y con únicamente la ayuda de la ganancia del trabajo en el taxi no es lo suficiente para mejorar su vivienda.
Es por esto que espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera dar lugar a la reconstrucción de la vivienda y continuar mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel R. drives a taxi. He works every day in the area of Leon, earning as much as he can to support his family. Each day he transports people around the city, but lately he has had to fight harder to find work. He has joined with Ceprodel to request a loan to help improve the living conditions for his 3 children. Their home has been in bad condition for a long time, and the income he earns from driving the taxi is not sufficient to make the repairs. He hopes that this loan will enable him to continue to improve the quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make necessary repairs on his home and improve the quality of life for his children

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
La señora Karen es socia del  Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente. Se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes. 

La señora Karen, tiene grado de instrucción superior completa y tiene 2 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año y medio.
Su primer préstamo fue de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.2500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de abarrotes como: azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener un carro y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros que gana
texts.en:
Karen, 33, is a member of the "3 de Mayo" communal bank. She lives in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She lives with her life partner and is a grocery merchant. Karen finished higher education and has two children. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year and a half. Her first, 500 new sol, loan was used to buy stock merchandise for her store. She now requests 2500 new soles to buy groceries like sugar, rice, pasta, etc. Her desire for the future is to own a car and that her children become professionals. What she likes most about her communal bank is the savings she incurs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, pasta, etc.

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
Maricruz tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a uno de sus hijos y su nieto de 5 años de edad en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace quince años se dedica al negocio de venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en el mercado de Cayaltí y en su domicilio. Este negocio ha sido la única fuente de ingreso con la que ha sacado adelante a sus dos hijos durante todo este tiempo y con el que actualmente sostiene la economía de su familia.

Su negocio goza de buena aceptación por parte de sus clientes debido al buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes. Maricruz desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de panetones y champagne por la campaña navideña, por tal motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su sueño es arreglar su casa y ver a su nieto convertido en un profesional exitoso. Ella es una mujer alegre, trabajadora y que ha sabido salir adelante sola a pesar de su condición de madre soltera.
texts.en:
Maricruz is 51 years old and a single mother. She lives with one of her children and a 5 year old grandson in the district of Cayaltí, which is located one hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For 15 years, she has been in the business of selling basic necessities and groceries at the Cayaltí Market and in her home. This has been in the only source of income with which she could successfully raise her two children throughout this entire time. She continues to support her family financially.

Her business is widely accepted by her customers due to the good service that she provides. Maricruz wants to expand her business by buying panettone and champagne for the Christmas season. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

Her dreams are to remodel her house and see her grandson become a successful professional. She is a cheerful, hardworking woman who has learned to succeed despite being a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase panettone & champagne for the Christmas season

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Rosa R., tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera, se dedica a confeccionar prendas, Camisas, Faldas, Pantalones, trajes para colegios,  pasa varias horas, costurando para poder entregar a sus clientes en la fecha estipulada.
es muy responsable, también esta colocando en empresas a las cuales les confecciona los uniformes y de esta forma obtiene mas ganacias, necesita el credito para comprar diferentes tipos de telas, hilos, botones, ya que es una temporada alta, también quiere ayudar a su madre a cambiarle todo el alumbrado electrico a la casa, Tiene problemas con la energia, Maria vive con su hijo de cuatro 
años, pasa pendiente de el todo el dia. Maria invierte mensual $ 683.62 y vende $1,022.00 obteniendo una utilidad mensual de $ 338.38, su meta para este año venidero es hacer su taller mas grande.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Rosa R. is 26 years old and a single mother. She produces shirts, skirts, trousers, and dresses for schools. Maria spends several hours sewing so that she can meet the deadlines for handing over finished products to her customers.

Maria is responsible. She also contracts with uniform manufacturing companies as a way to obtain extra income. This loan is needed to buy different types of fabrics, threads, and buttons since it is a peak season. Maria also wants to help her mother change all the electric lights in her house because she has problems with the electricity. She lives with her four year old son, who spends the entire day with her. Maria’s monthly expenditures total $683.62 and she sells $1022.00, leaving her a monthly profit of $338.38. Her goal for the coming year is to make her workshop bigger.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, threads, and buttons

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Suena Y Metas 1 Y 2 Group

texts.en:
Lina is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza because Esperanza can help supply her "fantasy". To explain: she plans to use this loan to invest in her business which is called a "fantasia" (or fantasy). The reason for the name is that these stores usually supply things that women and girls like such as stationary, clothing, underwear and other desirable items. With this loan, Lina will be looking to supply her store with blouses, women's pants and high heels. She will use the profit to supply her store. Her long-term goal is to earn enough profit to purchase a vehicle to move her merchandise. She thanks you all for your support.

Lina is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres con Suena y Metas ("Women with Goals and Dreams"), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the slums that ring the capital, Santo Domingo – an area plagued by crime where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her longtime partner and their three children.

loans.use: To buy blouses, pants and women's shoes

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: Cirilo tiene una edad de 63 años, es casado, tiene un hijo que depende completamente de él, mismo que estudia, su esposa se dedica a la venta de comidas de manera ambulante, tiene su vivienda propia en Barrio Belén. Cirilo es empleado en la Alcaldía de la localidad donde vive desde hace 9 años, su esposa es comerciante de comidas de manera ambulante desde hace mucho tiempo. Hay competencia, pero la señora tiene muchos clientes por ser antigua en el negocio, Cirilo es el único jardinero en la alcaldía. El destino del crédito es para la ampliación de su vivienda. Es su cuarto crédito secuencial, y tuvo muy buen comportamiento en los demás créditos.
texts.en:
Cirilo is 63 years old, married, and has a child who is studying and completely dependent on him. His wife sells food as a street vendor. He has his own home in the neighborhood of Belén. He has been working as a city employee for nine years. His wife has been working as a food merchant for a long time. There is competition, but Cirilo’s wife has many long-time customers who patronize her business. Cirilo is the only gardener employed by the city.

His loan will be used to expand his home. This is his fourth loan and he has performed very well with all of his previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of his house

loans.name: Ermitano

texts.es:
Ermitano es un padre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y su hijo de cuatro años de edad en la ciudad de Zaña, ubicada a 50 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años se dedica a la cría de animales. Los compra en los caseríos aledaños para luego engordarlos y venderlos a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Adicionalmente trabaja como operario de construcción. Estas actividades son la única fuente de ingreso económico con las que sostiene a su hogar.

El nos cuenta que hace poco ha adquirido dos vacas y las está criando para venderlas en el futuro, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para brindarles una adecuada alimentación. Por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternaiva un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Su más grande sueño es brindarle a su hijo una educación de calidad. El es un hombre trabajador y bastante entregado a su familia. En la fotografía aparece trabajando como operario de construcción.
texts.en:
Ermitano, 27, is married and the father of a 4-year-old son. He lives in the city of Zaña, which is 50 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. He has raised animals for sale for the last three years. He buys them in adjacent settlements, fattens them up, sells them to brokers who frequent the area. He also works in construction. These activities are his only sources of income with which he supports his household. He tells us that he acquired two cows recently that he is raising for future sale. However, he lacks the necessary funds to provide them with adequate nutrition. This has brought him to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to solicit funding in the amount of 500 new soles to invest in the purchase of nutritionally balanced feed. His greatest wish is to provide his son with a quality education. Ermitano is a hard-working man who is wholly dedicated to his family. In the photo, he appears as a construction worker.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced feed for cows.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La  Sra. Rosario L. M.  tiene 38 años de edad, tiene un Molino para quebrar maiz, se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana para atender a sus clientes y trabaja hasta las cinco de la tarde todos los dias, tambien vende ropa americana como ser camisas faldas, pantalones sueteres, Rosario es muy conocida por sus vecinos ya que es muy social y amable lo cual le ha veneficiado a tener buenas ventas,  vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo, el cuenta con su taller de soldadura y de esta forma pasan al cuidado de sus hijos, Rosario tiene un costo mensual de de $ 165.00 y obtiene ingresos de $ 480.00 generandole una ganacia de $ 315.00.
necesita el credito para comprar ropa interior como ser brasiere, bikines, calsetines y un fardo de ropa mixta ya que los clientes que van quebrar maiz le compran ropa, ahora la esta comprando por unidad en un mercado de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa. pero desea comprar un fardo de ropa para tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosario L. M. is 38. She has a mill to grind corn. She gets up at four in the morning to take care of her customers, and she works until five in the afternoon everyday. She also sells American clothes like shirts, skirts, pants and sweaters. Rosario is well known by her neighbors. She is very friendly and likeable, which has helped her to have good sales. She lives with her three children and her husband. He has a soldering shop. That way they take care of their children. Rosario’s monthly cost is $165.00. She takes in $480.00, generating $315.00 in earnings. She needs the loan to buy underwear like bras, bikinis, socks, and a bundle of mixed clothes. The customers who go to grind corn buy clothes. She is now buying by the unit in a market in the city of Tegucigalpa. But, she wants to buy a bundle of clothes to get greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used clothes in bundles

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Melita

texts.es:
Melita C. es una socia activa y perseverante, vive en el distrito de calleria, región de Ucayali, tiene 48 años, es madre de tres hijos mayores de edad, ella es costurera, cosmetóloga, y además trabaja en una empresa de servicios (limpieza),  su esposo la apoya con los gastos de la casa, él es mecánico. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desde hace ocho años, ella empezó en el Banco Comunal con un crédito de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en telas para confeccionar sus prendas de vestir. Actualmente Melita necesita un crédito de 800 soles que será invertido en el arreglo de sus maquinas de coser. La meta de Melita es llegar a tener una Botica, ya que una de sus hijas es enfermera y quiere apoyarla en todo lo que sea necesario para que se realice profesionalmente .
texts.en:
Melita C. is an active, supportive member who lives in the Callería District, Ucayali region. She is 48 years old, and the mother of three grown children. She is a seamstress and beautician, and also works for a cleaning company. Her husband (a mechanic) helps her with household expenses.

She has been part of the “Together Forever” Loan Group for eight years, where she started with a 300-sol loan to buy fabric to make garments. She currently needs an 800-sol loan to repair her sewing machines. Melita’s goal is to have her own store, for one of her daughters is a nurse, and Melita would like to support her in pursuing her career.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to pay for sewing-machine repair.

loans.name: Angelica De

texts.es: Angélica tiene 45 años de edad, es casada con dos hijos, la familia vive en un domicilio bajo la modalidad de anticrético. Posee un minibús que es de su propiedad, presta servicios de transporte de pasajeros. Su competencia en el mercado es alta por estar afiliada al sindicato de transportes. El préstamo está destinado para la compra de llantas para su minibús. Tiene buen historial crediticio en el sistema financiero.
texts.en:
Angélica, 45, is married and has two sons. The family lives in a home under the "anticrético" system (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you). She has a minibus with which she provides passenger transportation services. She faces a high degree of competiton because she is affiliated with the transportation service providers union. The funding will be used to buy tires for the minibus. She has a good credit history in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy minibus tires.

loans.name: G.s Las Mesitas Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Las Mesitas está conformado por Belma, Reina Margarita y Luisa las 3 se dedican a la misma actividad económica por lo que quisieron reunirse para formar un solo grupo y juntas realizar un financiamiento que le ayudara a salir adelante con cada uno de sus actividades económicas. Por lo que Luisa tiene 8 años de tener este negocio de pulpería que nació por medio porque ella anteriormente tenía la responsabilidad de mantener a sus hijos. La edad de Doña Luisa es de 71 años y debido a su edad decidió seguir adelante con este negocio. Por lo que el financiamiento que solicitan es para comprar en productos como golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan y granos básicos. Ya que son necesarios para mantener a sus clientes. Ellas sueñan con obtener estabilidad económica y debido a esta temporada es que ellas quieren invertir en su negocio lo suficiente para mantenerlo.
texts.en:
The Las Mesitas Communal Bank is comprised of Belma, Reina Margarita, and Luisa. The three of them work in the same economic activity. They wanted to get together to form one group and get a loan together. That will help them get ahead in each one of their activities. Luisa has had her business, a mini market, for eight years. It blossomed because she previously had to provide for her children. Luisa is 71. Due to her age, she decided to continue with this business. The loan they are asking for is to buy products like sweets, natural soft drinks, bread, and basic grains. These are necessary to keep their customers. They dream of getting economic stability. Because of this season they want to invest in their businesses sufficiently to maintain them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lucy Rossmeri

texts.es:
La señorita Lucy es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 18 años de edad y es soltera. Se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales 

La señorita Lucy estudió secundaria completa y no tiene hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de cereales.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.800.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de cereales de la región, como: papa, chuño, habas, etc.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener su capital propio el cual pueda invertir en su negocio.

Lo que mas le gusta las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Lucy, 18, is a member of the "Manuelas de Hoy II" communal bank. She lives in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. Lucy is single and she is a grains merchant. She studied secondary school and has no children. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year. Her first, 500 sol, loan was used to buy cereal grains. She will now request 800 new soles to buy regional grains like potatoes, freeze-dried potatoes, flat beans, etc. Her wish for the future is to have her own capital to invest in her business. What she likes best are the get-togethers with the fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy freeze-dried potatoes, potatoes, barley, etc.

loans.name: Felicita Mafalda

texts.es:
La Sra. Felicita Mafalda Z. A. tiene 62 años de edad, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado Urb. Pedreros – San Carlos – Ica zona afectada por la inundación del año 1997  y por el terremoto del 2007.
A pesar de eso la Sra. sigue adelante y vive con 3 de sus hijos los cuales son profesionales gracias a que es una persona bien trabajadora.
Actualmente es obrera de campo y reparte recibos de luz y agua. Trabaja de 6:00 am a 6:00 pm. y los fines de mes en las tardes reparte los recibos ya mencionados.
Es padre y madre para sus hijos, es por eso que solicita el financiamiento de un crédito para asumir gastos personales.
Cuenta con buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos.
texts.en:
Felicita Mafalda Z. A., 62, lives in the Pedreros Urbanization, San Carlos, Ica. This area was affected by the 1997 flood and the 2007 earthquake. Despite that, she perseveres. She lives with three of her children, who are professionals, thanks to her hard work. Currently, she works as a field hand and she distributes light and water bills. She works from 6am-6pm and at month's end she distributes the afore-mentioned utility bills. She is both mother and father to her children. This is the reason for her requesting funding to defray personal expenses. She has good references from her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe tiene 35 años, es concubino, su esposa no participa del crédito, por que tiene negocio independiente,  tiene 3 hijos, vivienda propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la actividad de comerciante, en las noches y los días sábados y domingos realiza servicio de mototaxi en el área urbana de de la localidad donde vive. En este barrio hay 4 tiendas sin embargo del señor Felipe es el mas surtido, cuenta con cabina telefónica de Viva. El destino del crédito es para Capital de operación para la ampliación de su negocio de abarrotes en su tienda de barrio. Es su cuarto crédito secuencial, su comportamiento fue muy bueno, en su crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Felipe, 35, is in a common-law relationship. His wife does not participate in the loan because she has her own business. He has three children and his own home. For the last 4 years he has been a merchant. At night and on week-ends he is a mototaxi driver in the urban area where he lives. There are four stores in his neighborhood but Felipe's is the best stocked and has a Viva telephone booth. The funding will be used as working capital to expand his neighborhood grocery store. This is his fourth consecutive loan; his behavior with his prior loans was very good.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” desde hace 5 años, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 51 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió hasta primaria (incompleta), se dedica a la venta de artesanías.

Graciela nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para comprar más artesanías las mismas que luego vendió.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2200.00 con el cual podrá comprar más mercadería como: lana, chalinas, chompas.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda de artesanías mejor implementado.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros
texts.en:
Mrs. Graciela has been a member of the “Third of May” Community Bank for the past five years. She lives in the “Llave” District, in El Collao Province, in the Department of Puno. She is 51 years old, divorced and has two children. She attended, but did not complete, primary school. She sells folkart. Graciela told us that with her first loan from the Manuel Ramos Movement, which was for 300.00 new soles, she was able to raise capital to buy more folkart of the same type that she sells. She is asking for a loan of 2,200 new soles with which she will buy more merchandise such as wool, scarves and sweaters. Her dream for the future is to have a well-stocked folkart store. What she likes the best about the Community Bank are their savings.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool, scarves and sweaters.

loans.name: Basilia De

texts.es: Basilia tiene casa propia, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, tiene 46 años de edad. Cuenta con el negocio de venta de almuerzos en el mercado Uruguay con 32 años de experiencia, el cónyuge es transportista asalariado, cuenta con 17 años de experiencia. Tiene competencia en el mercado, ya que la venta la realiza en un puesto fijo del mercado ubicado en la zona. El destino del crédito fue para capital de operación (compra de insumos, ollas, menaje y otros). Es su segundo crédito en la institución, cuenta con crédito en otras entidades financieras, este último con buen comportamiento crediticio.
texts.en:
Basilia, 46, has her own home, is married, and has two children. She has sold prepared meals in the Uruguay market for the past 32 years. Her husband has been a salaried truck driver for the past 17 years. She has competition in the market since she sells from a fixed point in the market in the area. The funding will be used as working capital (to buy ingredients, pots, kitchenware, etc.) This is her second loan with the institution; she has credit with other financial entities in which her credit history is good.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.es: Bonifacio tiene 57 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, tiene dos hijos que dependen aún de él, la familia vive en una vivienda propia. Con la actividad de venta de papa, chuño y tunta, comercializa en las ferias de la localidad, con 31 años de experiencia juntamente con su esposa. Su competencia es media, porque Bonifacio es responsable con sus clientes. El destino del crédito es para la Compra de mercadería al por mayor “papa, chuño y tunta”. Este es su tercer crédito, en sus créditos anteriores trabajo de manera optima, no tiene obligaciones con otras Entidades Financieras.
texts.en:
Bonifacio, 57, is married and has two dependent children; the family lives in their own house. He, together with his wife, has sold potatoes, chuño (freeze-dried potato, for making vegetable soup), and tunta (white chuño) in the local markets for the last 31 years. His competition is moderate because Bonifacio is responsible with his customers. The financing will be used to buy merchandise at wholesale. This is his third loan. He managed his previous loans optimally and he has no financial obligations with other financial entities.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients at wholesale.  Potatoes, chuño (freeze-dried potato, for making vegetable soup), tunta (white chuño)

loans.name: Herman

texts.es: Herman tiene 38 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y tiene vivienda propia. Herman trabaja como empleado de una empresa como electricista, y además presta servicio particular de electricista los fines de semana. Su empleo dependiente es seguro, y la competencia como electricista es baja, ya que no hay muchas personas que se dediquen a este rubro. El destino del crédito es para compra de moto para poder transportarse  en la misma. En Agrocapital ha pagado con bastante  puntualidad, también en otras entidades financieras.
texts.en:
Herman is 38, married, with one son and he has his own home. He works as an employee in a business as an electrician, and also offers his services as an electrician on weekends. His main work is steady, and there is little competition for electricians as there aren’t many people working in this field. The loan will be used to buy a motorbike for his own transportation. He has been quite punctual with his payments to Agrocapital, as well as in other business transactions. .

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Hilda María

texts.es:
la sra. Hilda Maria B. tiene 59 años de edad, vive en la colonia altos de la Sosa de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene mucho tiempo de realizar este tipo de actividad, sus ventas son muy buenas y tiene clientes fijos todos los dias, reparte su producto en diferntes casas en barrios y colonias cercanas a su hogar, tambien los distribuye en pulperias. a veces los fines de semana tiene encargos para reuniones y hace bastantes tortillas.
ahora necesita el credito para comprar mas costales de harina de maiz, cal, agua. para estar bien abastecida y no tener problemas al momento de tener una produccion grande. en estas fechas que son de fiestas siempre tiene muchos encargos y su produccion aumenta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda Maria B. is 59 years old and lives in Colonia Altos de la Sosa in the City of Tegucigalpa. She dedicates herself to the production and sale of tortillas. She has done this for a long time. Her sales are very good and she has a fixed set of customers every day. She distributes her production in different houses in neighborhoods and colonias close to her home. She also distributes them to small grocery stores. And at times, on weekends she fills orders for large gatherings. Hilda makes lots of tortillas!

Now she needs a loan to buy large bags of corn flour, lime, and water in order to be well supplied and to avoid last minute problems when having to produce large quantities. In this holiday season she always has lots of orders to fill and her production increases.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY FIREWOOD, CORN FLOUR, WATER, MATCHES AND LIME FOR MAKING TORTILLAS

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dora Celina De

texts.es: Dora vive junto a sus hijos esta a cargo de los gastos de la casa sus hijos están en edad de estudio por otra parte el padre no convive con la familia pero si les pasa pensiones trabaja en una flota, Dora gracias a su esfuerzo también genera ingresos como enfermera en una clínica, Dora mantiene residencia domiciliaria con casa propia. Dora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes  al por menor compra por mayor  y reparte en zona a dos pagos. Por otra parte, compra productos de temporada, a la fecha esta comprando productos de navidad. La competencia es media, sin embargo por la gran experiencia adquirida ha desarrollado habilidades y destrezas en el negocio lo cual le ayuda bastante ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes. Con el crédito obtenido de la institución Dora está financiando capital de trabajo ya que la temporada es alta por estar cerca de fin de año. Y esta pagando un saldo de agrocapital. Su comportamiento de pagos de Dora es bueno ya que su promedio de días  mora es de cero días.  Y se encuentra en su cuarta secuencia de créditos.
texts.en:
Dora lives with her children and is in charge of the household expenses. Her children are students. Their father doesn’t live with the family but he sends money from his work on a boat. Thanks to Dora’s efforts from her work as a nurse in a clinic, she is also able to provide income. Dora lives in her own house. She sells food retail which she buys wholesale, and delivers in the area to customers who pay on credit in two payments. She also purchases seasonal products: she is currently buying Christmas items. The competition is normal, but she has acquired a lot of experience and developed her abilities and skills in the business. This has helped her a lot and now she is very popular with her customers. With the loan that she received from the institution, Dora is putting capital into the business since the season is short- being close to the end of the year. And she is paying a balance to agrocapital. Dora’s history of payments is good and her average of late days is zero. This is her fourth loan.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: La familia de Reina está compuesta por 4 personas, Reina tiene 42 años, su hija 16 años, dos varones un 12 y 4 años actualmente vive sola. La vivienda que tiene actualmente es de un cuarto con obra bruta, cuenta con servicios básicos. Reina se dedica a la preparación y elaboración de pan, también vende refrigerios ya que su domicilio se encuentra muy cerca del colegio modelo de la localidad. Reina es la única clienta que se dedica a la elaboración de pan y la competencia es muy baja, por lo mismo tiene mucha demanda ya que todo lo que produce termina de vendarla. El destino del crédito es para la construcción de vivienda, actualmente está construyendo un cuarto más y cuenta con el material necesario como se puede apreciar en la fotografía de Reina. Reina es clienta antigua en nuestra institución con dos operaciones canceladas anteriormente de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Reina's family consists of 4 people. Reina is 42 years old, her daughter is 16, and the two boys are 12 and 4. She is currently single. Her home is a crudely-built room with basic amenities. Reina prepares and bakes bread. She also sells snacks because she lives close to the local design school. Reina is the only client that makes bread and she doesn't have much competition. At the same time, the demand is high and she sells everything she produces. The loan will be used for construction on her home; she is building an additional room and has all the materials necessary, as shown in the photograph. Reina is one our institution's oldest clients, with two previous loans that were repaid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Rory Rafaela

texts.es:
La señora  RORY S. C., tiene  38 años, vive en el distrito de la BUENOS AIRES, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria y  tiene 3 hijos  de los cuales 2 dependen económicamente de ella porque se encuentran estudiando. La socia se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos y de menús los fines de semana en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró arroz, menestras, fideos, papas, pollo, carne, aceite, platos y cubiertos para la venta de sus menús (alimentos).
Con este crédito de 500 comprará cosméticos como: colonias, cremas, talco, labiales, aretes, pulseras. etc.
Ella sueña con tener su restaurante en su casa para así poder generar mayores ganancias y poder apoyarlos a sus hijos en en sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
RORY S. C., 38, lives in the Buenos Aires district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras II communal bank. She finished 11th grade and has three children, two of whom still depend on her because they are students. She sells cosmetics and prepared meals on weekends in her home. With her first, 300 sol, loan she bought rice, vegetables, pastas, potatoes, meat, oil, dishes and cutlery for her prepared meal sales. With this 500 sol loan she will buy cosmetics like colognes, creams, talc, lipsticks, earrings, bracelets, etc. She dreams with having a restaurant in her home to generate greater profits and be able to help her children with their higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin de 34 años es casado hace varios años con la Sra. Eva de 31 años, en cuyo hogar existen dos hijos de 10 y 6 años, gracias al trabajo de ambos lograron contar con casa propia. Edwin se dedica al rubro del transporte con su propia herramienta de trabajo en donde es afiliado a una línea de transporte que tienen gran demanda de pasajeros, su esposa tiene su tienda de barrio en su domicilio particular en donde ofrece variedad de productos. Si bien existe competencia en todos los rubros, Edwin tiene la ventaja de pertenecer a una asociación en la cual realizan servicio único a la zona norte y tiene buena demanda, su esposa gracias a la ubicación de su tienda cuenta con bastante clientela que la visita a diario para comprar los productos que ofrece. El crédito solicitado fue para el mantenimiento general de su vagoneta. Edwin es cliente antiguo en la institución accedió a 4 créditos anteriores, todos con excelente comportamiento en el pago de sus cuotas, Edwin es fiel con la institución por agradecimiento al crecimiento económico que tuvo con los créditos de Agrocapital.
texts.en:
Edwin is 34 years old and has been married for several years to Sra. Eva, who is 31 years old. They have two children, ages 10 and 6. Thanks to both of them working, they have been able to acquire their own home. Edwin works in the transportation business and has his own vehicle. The route he is affiliated with experiences great passenger demand. His wife operates a neighborhood grocery store out of their home where she offers a variety of products. While competition exists everywhere, Edwin has the advantage of belonging to an association that provides the only service in the northern district, which has high demand. Thanks to the location of her store, his wife encounters enough customers who come by each day to buy the products she offers. The loan he is requesting was used for general vehicle maintenance. Edwin is a long-time client of the Institution who has accessed four previous loans, and successfully repaid all of them. He is loyal to the Institution because of the financial growth he has experienced resulting from the loans from Fundación AgroCapital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of millet for beverage production

loans.name: Beatriz Adriana

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Beatriz Adriana B. le está haciendo falta el vitropiso en toda la casa. 
Desea realizar la mejora lo más antes posible ya que tiene dos niños pequeños y no quiere se le enfermen por la humedad, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario.  Es por eso que está solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora.
La señora Beatriz Adriana se dedica a elaborar banquetes de comida para eventos sociales y venta de pasteles, con las ganancias del negocio será para pagar el crédito, ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su esposo el señor José Guadalupe Aguilar con el ingreso de su trabaja en una compañía de gas en el departamento de entregas a domicilio.
texts.en:
The home of señora Beatriz Adriana B. lacks tiled floors. She hopes to put in the best flooring possible because she has two young children and she doesn't want them to get sick from the humidity, but at the moment she doesn't have the money. This is why she is asking for a loan to buy the flooring material and to pay someone to do the work.

Señora Beatriz Adriana prepares food for banquets and social events and sells desserts, with the profits from her business she will be able to pay the loan. Her husband, Jose Guadalupe Aguilar, will be able to cover the family expenses with the income from his work at a gas company in the home delivery department.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacing the floor in her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of rice and beans for catering.

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Robert es un padre de familia de 25 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa, un hijo de un año y siete meses de edad y dos hijos del anterior compromiso de su esposa en el distrito de Zaña, ubicado a 50 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de animales menores y ganado porcino. Compra los animales a los habitantes de los caseríos aledaños para engordarlos y luego vender su carne en el mercado de Cayaltí. Por otro lado se dedica a trabajar como operario de construcción. Estas actividades son fuentes de ingreso para solventar los gastos familiares.

La continua demanda por el producto que ofrece ha hecho que Robert ya no tenga animales para seguir vendiendo por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de cerdos para su posterior engorde y venta.

El es un padre bastante entregado a su familia por lo que siempre da todo de sí para sacarlos adelante. Su más grande anhelo es hacer arreglos en su casa ya que está construida de material rústico y cada verano las lluvias la deterioran aún mas. En la fotografía aparece trabajando como operario de construcción en una obra cercana al lugar donde vive.
texts.en:
Robert is a 25 year old father with a wife and a 19 month old son. They also live with his wife’s two children from a previous marriage in the district of Zaña, which is 50 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Robert sells small livestock and pigs. He buys animals for fattening from the inhabitants of the surrounding villages and later sells the meat at the market in Cayaltí. In addition, he is a construction worker. These activities are the sources of income that allow him to meet his family expenses.

Robert continues to experience demand for his products, but he does not have animals available for him to continue selling. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 soles to buy pigs for fattening and selling.

Robert is a devoted father who wants to give his family everything they need to get ahead. His greatest dream is to remodel his home because it is currently built from basic materials that continue to deteriorate from the summer rains. In the photograph, he is pictured at a construction job on a building located near where he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs to fatten & sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de ocho años tiene una bodega en su casa en la cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes a sus clientes. Este negocio constituye una importante ayuda para solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio ha dido creciendo con el tiempo y goza de buena aceptación por parte de sus clientes debido a la calidad del trato que brinda. Katia se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de abarrotes para surtir y ampliar su bodega.

Ella es una madre responsable que siempre trabaja por el bienestar de su familia. Su más grande anhelo es ver a sus dos hijos convertidos en profesionales. Este es su segundo crédito con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus cuotas por lo que es considerada una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Katia is 39 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the district of Cayaltí, which is located one hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than eight years, Katia has managed a store in her home where she offers basic necessities and groceries to her customers. This business is important in helping her meet her family’s expenses.

Her business has grown over time and is widely accepted by her customers because of the quality service provided. Katia has come to Edpyme Alternativa to request a loan of 1000 soles to purchase groceries to restock and expand her store.

She is a responsible mother who always works for the welfare of her family. Her greatest desire is to see her two children become professionals. This is her second loan with Edpyme Alternativa. She has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments and is therefore considered an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying beauty products for resale

loans.name: Cleodomira Flor

texts.es:
La señora CLEODOMIRA FLOR tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de la BUENOS AIRES provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II.  Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, es casada y tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró colonias, perfumes, labiales, cremas, talcos, etc.
Con su próximo crédito de 800 soles viajará a la ciudad de Lima a comprar ropa como: pantalones, blusas, polos, sabanas, etc. 
Cleodomira sueña con adecuar un lugar en su domicilio en donde exhibir la ropa que venderá.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cleodomira is 35 years old. She lives in the Buenos Aires District, in the Trujillo Province, in La Libertad Department in Peru. She is a member of the “Enterprising Women II” Community Bank. She has finished her studies up to the fifth level in secondary school. She is married and has two children that depend on her economically. She sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothes and also she sells cosmetics. With her first loan of 300.00 new soles, she bought colognes, perfumes, lipsticks, creams, powders, etc. With this loan of 800 soles she will travel to Lima to buy clothes such as pants, blouses, T-shirts, sheets, etc. Cleodomira’s dream is to obtain a place in her home where she can display the clothes that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes such as pants, blouses, T-shirts, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a new motor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Bethia Ines

texts.es:
La señora Bethia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao; ella tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene 03 hijos, quienes dependen de ella. Estudio hasta quinto de secundaria.
Bethia trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años; se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y ovino. 
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compró ovejas.

Ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en la compra de ganado (2 toros).
Su visión hacia el futuro es mejorar su negocio y comprar mas  ganado vacuno.
Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los interese que son bajos, además de la puntualidad de sus socias.
texts.en:
Bethia is a member of the communal bank “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” in the district of Pilcuyo in El Collao province. She is 38 years old, married, and has 3 dependent children. She completed her studies through the fifth year of secondary school. Bethia has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 4 years; she has a business buying and selling livestock (cows and sheep.)
